input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "2-Way Car Alarm System w/ Remote Start" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: If installed on a manual car, does the system check gear before starting the engine? Do you recomend installing this as a DIY?
Answer:
output_field: This system is design for both automatic and manual. To install on car with stick shift you will need to cut a wire on the remote start module. It is a must otherwise it would not work on manual. The installation instruction will shows you where to cut a wire, it is very easy. Once the wire cut, the module will only engage through a sequence of setup. It will not engage when vehicle is in gear. Yes, you can do it yourself, make sure you understand your vehicle wiring diagrams. Good luck...

input_field:
Instruction: Concerning the product "Fenix Flashlights 170 Lumens Flashlight (Upgraded), 1.5-Inch, Black", answer the query provided below.
Question: Would this work as a CR123 "vampire" to drain used batteries?
Answer:
output_field: The Fenix E15 runtime on its highest power setting is 111 minutes for a 1400mA CR123. So less than a 1 amp drain. It would do the job except Fenix lights typically drop to a lower power when the LED overheats. According to the E15 manual "The flashlight will drop down into Mid output after working about 15 minutes in High output. Therefore, the runtime of High output is an accumulated time." You probably want to look for a better solution, particularly if you regularly need to drain batteries. It's a nice little light though and well worth having.

input_field:
Instruction：Based on the product "OC Gizmo LED Work Light Lamp Off Road High Power ATV Jeep 4x4 Tractor 27W Round 30 Degree Round Spot Light"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：Can I use I 12 volt 6amp computer power supply to power this?
Output：
output_field: I am not sure of your power supply's AC ripple characteristics, a computer power supply has a definite purpose, charging a battery which serves to help diminish the AC ripple component of the power supply output. Any significant ripple will cause your LED's to flicker at 60Hz. Since your LED load is about 5 amps I would assume that flicker would be substantial with a supply of this type. I do not believe that it will damage the LED's or the power supply but if your power supply doesn't have good regulation to damp the ripple you could experience annoying flicker which in some cases can make you feel ill, or uncomfortable.

output_field: I got it to work, but to the receiving listener the voice quality is terrible. I left myself a voice mail at work by calling out using the cell phone line and yes, the voice quality is terrible with the iPhone 4S iOS 5. I am not sure how to fix this problem. Regarding connecting, follow the instructions and then on your iPhone go to Settings >> General >> Bluetooth. Make sure bluetooth is "on" of course, then when it displays the model number of the Panasonic phone, click on that box on your iPhone, then it will change the screen and show it's attempting to link to the base unit (which it does -- it just doesn't work very well). UPDATE 10/21/12: I upgraded to iOS 6 to see if that would fix the problem, and it did. When I speak using the Bluetooth option it now sounds fine.

input_field:
Instruction：Based on the product "Bob's Red Mill Organic Whole Grain Buckwheat Groats Raw, 16-Ounce Packages (Pack of 4)"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：I've always recieved mixed answers on whether buckwheat (like this item) is gluten free or not? Please let me know which is correct for this item.
Output：
output_field: Everything I read says ...yes, it is gluten free. But that only depends upon the facility if is processed in, if they also handle wheat products Here us a snippet from Celiac.com. Celiac.com 10/18/2013 - Buckwheat, sometimes referred to as kasha, is often billed as a "tasty alternative to wheat." That's all well and good, but is it really gluten-free, and generally considered safe to eat for those who suffer from celiac disease or a gluten sensitivity? The Facts Good news! With its non-wheat status, buckwheat is safely gluten-free. Buckwheat and wheat are, come to find out, actually from completely different botanical families. Derived from the seeds of a flowering plant, buckwheat is not considered a grain or a cereal (though it may be called a pseudo-cereal-don't let that scare you). Buckwheat, in all of its gluten-free glory, is actually closely related to rhubarb. In addition, it is an excellent source of fiber and nutrients. In particular, buckwheat groats (the small, triangular seeds), when cooked, offer 17 grams of dietary fiber or 68% of the daily requirement for a 2,000 calorie per day diet, as well as 22 grams of protein.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Fredrix 3501 Canvas Pads, 12 by 16-Inch" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: how do you frame the sheet of a canvas pad?
Answer:
output_field: I usually mask the edges with masking tape to get a really crisp clean edge and then mount the painting behind a mat with the edge showing. Another way. if you are painting with oils, is to protect the back with greased paper and masking tape before you begin painting. The finished painting can then be glued to a cradled panel - not wrapped around, or it can be wrapped around a panel and glued at the back. the panel can then be framed conventionally. Personally, I like to cut the sheet into 4, mask all around to give a white border and then frame the individual pieces in equal sized frames with a wide mat and hang all 4 together - 2 side by side with the other 2 underneath and about 1 cm gap between the frames. I find this way of working is most successful when the frames are quite a bit larger than the little paintings inside.

input_field:
Instruction: In light of the product "Celestron 71008 SkyMaster 25x70 Binoculars (Black)" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: I have an Orion Goscope (80mm) telescope, am i going in reverse by buying this 25x70 binocs/
Output:
output_field: Look at it this way; there is no way that a binoculars can replace a telescope not unless its for land or terrestrial use. Once you're looking into space and seeing the planetary system, binoculars are pretty great but using a telescope its a different ball game altogether. I've never had the privilege to look into a telescope before but I have many acquaintances told me its so much details you can see. I've looked at Jupiter with this pair of binoculars and I can clearly see three of its moons and I can also see some of Jupiter's coloration. I'm pretty sure with a telescope you'll see much much more details. All in all binoculars have its place for planetary viewing especially these SkyMasters, they're a class of its own. But in comparison to an Orion Goscope (80mm) telescope there's absolutely no binoculars that I can compare it with.

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "Doctor's Best Best Stabilized R-Lipoic Acid Featuring Bioenhanced Na-RALA (100 mg), Vegetable Capsules, 60-Count", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: What is the difference between NA-RALA vs regular RALA? I am a little wary of the Na ( Sodium), would it be harmful?
Output:
output_field: From: https://www.customcapsule.com/show_description.asp?original=Y&product_id=144 Na R-Alpha Lipoic Acid (NaR-ALA) is the sodium salt of R-alpha lipoic acid (R-ALA). This form is much more bioavailable than unmodified R-ALA. The increased bioavailability means that even though sodium R-ALA only contains 70% R-ALA it can enter the blood stream in higher concentrations than an equivalent dose of R-ALA. R-ALA is an enzyme co-factor found in mitochondria that functions as an antioxidant. The "R" in R-Alpha Lipoic acid specifies the active form of this molecule. Fom: http://www.longecity.org/forum/topic/60630-r-ala-vs-ala-vs-rla-vs-na-r-ala/ RLA and R-ALA both mean the same thing. Na- or K- just indicates whether it's a sodium or potassium salt of R(A)LA - there's a very slight potency difference because potassium is heavier than sodium, but that's it.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Olympus OM-D E-M10 Compact System Camera (Silver)- Body only" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: EM10 for $699 or EM5 for $599?
Answer:
output_field: Both are superb still cameras. There are only 2 advantages that the E-M5 has over the E-M10. It is weather resistant (note I did NOT say Weather PROOF), and it has the first generation 5 axis image stabilization. However, if those things aren't important to you, I would say the E-M10 is the wiser purchase. My reasons are that the 10 has a slightly better image processor. It isn't a huge improvement in image quality but it IS ever so slightly better. And while the 5 axis image stabilization is better than 3, many people feel the 5 axis IS is most useful for video rather than stills. And frankly if you are interested in video, neither is the camera for serious videography. Both, however are adequate for the sort of video snapshots I do. So for me, I think the only REAL advantage of the E-M5 is the weather resistance, and THAT will only function if you have weather resistant lenses as well. Otherwise, you are as unprotected as the E-M10 user. Only you can decide if the 5's slightly reduced image quality is worth $100. Personally, I would (and did) spend an extra $100 and buy the E-M10

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "Grape Solar GS-STAR-100W Polycrystalline Solar Panel, 100-watt", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: can I hook a 12v dc submersible water pump to 2 of these directly thanks
Output:
output_field: Solar panels are really meant to be used to charge batteries, generally (highly recommended) via a charge controller. 12V devices (such as your pump) can then be connected directly to the battery terminals -- the battery acts as a voltage/current buffer. The batteries are generally deep-cycle (such as RV/marine batteries). The problem with connecting a pump directly is that the voltage from the panels will fluctuate depending on load and solar loading, and not all DC motors do okay with fluctuating voltages -- you'd have to check that this is okay with yours.

Output:
output_field: Organic gemstones such as pearls, amber, coral, and ivory should not be cleaned in an ultrasonic cleaner or cleaned with an abrasive or ammonia based cleaner. Your emeralds and diamonds should be just fine if they are in a sturdy setting. A good discussion of the do's and don'ts of this topic, including your emeralds, is available at the site All About Gemstones, here: http://www.allaboutgemstones.com/jewelry_cleaning.html

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "Kohler 84999 Toilet Seat Anchor Kit" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: Can I take out the anchor screws that are in my Rialto toilet with this kit? I need to take them out to buy a new seat
Response:
output_field: It's been a couple years since I did mine, it was a bit of work and I'm a professional craftsman. First of all, be very careful and patient, take your time not to break the porcelain. The original aluminum screws are a pain in the neck, there is a tool included that you can use underneath the anchor to hold it still while extracting the screws. If that doesn't work, try cutting them flush with a short hacksaw and then drilling them out. Then, gently tap and push the original anchors through and in to the base, you won't need them. Then, read the directions very carefully and then read them again...follow them strictly. This kit works very well and you'll be very happy. Hope this helps.

input_field:
Instruction：Based on the product "Organic Elder Berries"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：Is it cheaper to boil the berries for syrup and if so, how do you do it?
Output：
output_field: It is much cheaper to make your own than to buy store brands like Sambucol. You just boil 3/4 to 1 cup of the dried berries in a quart of water until the liquid is reduced by half, strain it through a cheesecloth, add 1/2 to 1 cup of raw honey, sugar or pure maple syrup according to taste, and put it in a jar in the fridge. If that's too much work you can make an elixir by steeping about 3 oz of the berries in a pint of good brandy with about half a cup of raw honey (or more to taste) in a sealed jar in your cupboard for 6 weeks.

output_field: Look inside the left vegetable draw. There is a white 3 inch plastic on the inside side. Gently lift it up and look on the back side and snap off the filter. Look at the right side at the top. Pull open from the bottom the door. You will see the other filter and pull it out when you order another one. Amazon is the best. Very reasonable prices. Pull other one out and insert new one. Good Luck Toni

input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "Honeywell RTH6450D1009 5-1-1-Day Programmable Thermostat" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: disable smart response honeywell rth6450d1009 thermostat
Answer:
output_field: The SMART Response Technology can be turned ON/OFF by using the following steps: (from the RTH6450's manual# 69-2416ES-05, Pg. #21) 1) Press and hold the "up arrow" AND the "FAN" buttons until the screen changes (approximately 5 seconds). 2) the number that appears on the "left" of the screen is the Function#, the number on the right of the screen is its corresponding SettingValue 2) Press "Next" (bottom right) until you reach "13" on the "left" of the screen (i.e. Function# "13" - this is the function for Smart Response Technology) 3) if the number on the "right" of the screen is "1" (i.e. if the SettingValue is "1") then the smart technology is "ON" if the number on the "right" of the screen is "0" (i.e. if the SettingValue is "0") then the smart technology is "OFF" 4) Use the "up arrow" or the "down arrow" to change this SettingValue to suit your preference. 5) Press "Done" (bottom left) to save changes and exit. Hope this helps.

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Standard Horizon HX100 Standard HX100 Handheld VHF Marine Radio, Set of Two." answer the inquiry below.
Input: What is the difference between model hx100 and hx150 ? the range ?.. this is two radios set isn't ? .. thank you
Output:
output_field: The HX100 is listed as 2.5W unit and the HX150 is listed as 5.0W unit by various resellers on Amazon. The 2.5W and 5.0W ratings if I'm not mistaken are connected to the transmission power or range of the units. The HX100 is a two radio set. The HX150 is sold as a single unit with a different battery, charger and full battery charge light that is not on the HX100. The battery and battery connector are not the same. A 3 pin FNB124LI is used for the HX150 and a 2 pin FNB125 is used for the HX100. The HX100 will use the CD56 charger and the HX150 will use the CD57 charger. The HX100 takes 10 Hours to fully charge and the HX150 only requires 6 hours to fully charge. After briefly looking through the manual I could find no other differences between the two units. Please note the manufacture's website listed a car adapter for the chargers but I didn't get one in my HX100 package. The car charger was not listed or shown on the box and may or may not be provided with the HX150.

Instruction：Based on the product "Dr. Christopher's Original Formulas Thyroid Maintenance Formula Capsules, 100 Count"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：what kind of "natural herbs" are in this?
Output：
output_field: It contains kelp, watercress, nettle leaf, mullein leaf, parsley leaf, Irish moss, and sheep sorrel herb. It will NOT replace the thyroid hormone your thyroid should produce, but doesn't (if you have hypothyroidism). Dr. Christopher's has another formula called Herbal Thyroid (rather than "Thyroid Maintenance"), which contains Guarana SiberianGinseng Fo-Ti Gotu Kola Mullein and Kelp. Instructions are to take the Herbal Thyroid to kickstart a lazy thyroid. But I think even that one doesn't replace your low or absent hormone; for that, you really do need the thyroid meds your allopathic doctor will prescribe for you. Take it from me--I've tried all three, and though I believe in herbal medicine wherever possible, it wasn't until I used the prescription that my symptoms (sensitivity to cold and a general fatigue were the worst, among others) went away. Good luck with your condition!

I have an S3 and it fits great! Dimensions for the S3 are 136.6 x 70.6 x 8.6 mm (5.38 x 2.78 x 0.34 in). Dimensions for the S4 are 136.6 x 69.8 x 7.9 mm (5.38 x 2.75 x 0.31 in). The S4 appears to be the same height, a slightly narrower width, and more noticeably thinner depth. It is an "at your own risk" thing, but I can't see why you would have any real issues. Hope that helps!

Response:
output_field: I would get a plastic container large enough to fit your Sloggers. Fill it with enough water so the grooves are covered. The shoes may start to float. If they do, just put a clean rock inside the shoes. I've tried those porcupine style shoe scrappers. They were a waste of money. I always leave a chair, an extra pair of shoes and a towel on a mat by the hose. I wash off the Sloggers, step on the mat to dry off, and then I'm ready for the next project. Try writing Sloggers, I'm certain they've been asked this question before. I hope this helps.

input_field:
Instruction: Concerning the product "Behringer EUROLIVE B205D Active 150-Watt PA/Monitor Speaker System", answer the query provided below.
Question: How would I hook up a hard disc recorder for recording thru this?
Answer:
output_field: You have to do that through the rear, all the connections from the front is input based, so that you can connect your line in, be it a microphone, iPod or media player but from the rear, there are two cannon connections, one is designed as a line-out and the second is for looping through a couple of them together, just incase you have a few units to be used all at the same time. So whichever device, you'll love to capture the audio output with, just make sure it has a cable interface with a basic 3pin cannon plug connector, then you connect it to the line-out (not the second connector as that is an input only for looping multiple units together) then the signal will be recorded sweetly. If you are using multiple speakers maybe like 3 or 4 units looped together, then you must connect the recorder to the last speaker box in the loop as the line-out will be free for tethering any recorder. I hope this helps!

input_field:
Instruction：Based on the product "Pioneer HTP-071 5.1 Channel Home Theater System (Discontinued by Manufacturer)"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：What types of inputs and outputs does it have on the back? and how many?
Output：
output_field: I think this might have all the details you're looking for: http://docs.pioneer.eu/Manuals/HTP_071_5707_00000_611_0S_manual/ I'm just using HDMI w/ embedded audio, but it has coax and optical for audio as well (and it will accept & process 7.1 in addition to 5.1, although to do 7.1 you need an external amp to do the side speakers - it has only amps for the 5.1 channels and then 2 RCA outs for the side channels). Other interesting thing to note is that it switches video w/ audio of course, BUT does not allow for any conversion of video format. So, while it has analog video inputs, it will only send those analog video signals to an analog video signal output, not the HDMI output (and vice versa w/ the HDMI - the HDMI video input can only be routed to the HDMI video output, not the analog video output). I like this unit. The speakers leave a bit to be desired, but the receiver is a solid foundation for a decent home theater setup.

Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Identity Stronghold RFID Blocking Secure Sleeve / Case for Id & Credit Card - Pack of 10" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: As stated it only protect cards that are 13+ghz, how can we tell whether our cards fit the protection criteria?
Output:
output_field: Assuming you meant 13+ MHz (mega/Millions of Hertz/cycles-per-second) rather than 13+ GHz (giga/Billions of Hertz/cycles-per-second), I believe you'll find the answer in the table at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radio-frequency_identification . If I interpret that table correctly, the only RFID things in a band lower than 13 MHz are pet identification systems (i.e. "chip the dog") and many employee identification and other workplace-related systems; _all_ financial-type cards are 13+ MHz.

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "Kinderglo Portable Fun and Safe Rechargeable Night Light, Elephant" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: Blue light is bad to use because it stunts melatonin. Is there an option of yellow light? Can't imagine red wd be soothing.
Response:
output_field: Hello Ninjabetic, and thanks for your question. At this time, a solid yellow setting is not available for the KinderGlo. The four light settings are solid green, solid blue, solid red, and continuous color changing. While some of the colors in the cycle are brighter than others, in general all of the light settings are soft enough to sleep by. As far as concerns about impeding melatonin levels, the science behind this shows that lights with a brightness of under 5 lux have no effect on the body's production of melatonin. Because we use soft LED lights which are then filtered through a translucent plastic body, the brightness of the KinderGlo never reaches 1 lux. The lights are bright enough to see by, but soft enough to sleep by.

Instruction：Based on the product "Brother SA213 Serger Gathering Foot"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：Is this for a sewing machine or just for a serger
Output：
output_field: It is just a serger, but sergers are nothing like a sewing machine. This serger is wonderful, especially for the price. There are sewing machines who have "serging attachments" but they really do not serge. A serger is a unique machine, and I use it for all my quilt blocks, when I do alterations, for decorative finishes on items, but never for seams, it finishes seams, and things like that. Hope that helps you.

input_field:
Instruction：Based on the product "NEW Black Velvet Pad Tray Insert Jewelry Display !!!"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：I am not buying this for a display tray. Can I cut it to fit the bottom of my jewelry box?
Output：
output_field: Hello Tiffany, The Velvet Felt on the tray an very nice and feels like a good quality, but the stiffness of the tray felt like a Hard Board - the type you find in hardware stores that has many holes to fit metal pegs into them to hang tools (except the board is smooth). I've cut these boards before and using a hand saw is almost out of the question, as it will be messy and crooked. If you have a cross-cut saw such as a radial arm or a chop-type mitre saw, it should work out fine. However, you'll also need to undo the velvet to separate the board for cutting, then re-wrap your board. I wish I could look at mines to tell you more if the velvet could be undone, but I just threw my tray away. Sorry about that.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Rugged Ridge 15100.01 8,500Lb Winch with Steel Cable", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: will this winch fit on stock bumpers
Response:
output_field: No, stock factory bumpers will not support a winch or the forces involved with a recovery operation. Depending on what you drive there may be options to keep your stock bumper and add in winch support frames/skeletons that will hold a winch and withstand the forces involved but keep a relatively looking stock bumper intact. I run one such system on my Jeep XJ. It's called the Detours USA Backbone bumper system. Do yourself a favor and buy an actual winch bumper or support. Even Wranglers require some kind of support plate to support a winch.

input_field:
Instruction: Concerning the product "Oxy-Sorb 100-Pack Oxygen Absorber, 100cc", answer the query provided below.
Question: How are the Oxygen Adsorbers used
Answer:
output_field: What makes food go stale and spoil quickly is oxygen, by using these oxygen absorbers they reduce that. I dehydrate fruit and vegetables in a food dehydrator then place them in clean mason jars and add one oxygen absorber and close up the jar. In a about 4-6 hours you will hear the top pop inward and the oxygen has been taken out. These jars I use in daily cooking. For long-term food storage I put the dehydrated food into a vacuum seal bag and put in one oxygen absorber then vacuum seal removing all the air, this bag is put into a mylar bag and sealed, then put into a 5-gallon bucket with two oxygen absorbers (food can last for 20 years). All the food we have done this with has been perfect. I hope this helps.

Instruction: Using the details of the product "GATSBY MOVING RUBBER AIR RISE Hair Wax, 80g/2.8oz" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: (For pink moving rubber) What are some best practices for getting all of it out of your hair? Just using one application of shampoo doesn't work.
Response:
output_field: I would suggest washing a few more times. Or using less of it, as it's a strong wax and not much is needed. I don't know what your hair is like, but I'm Asian, and I only need a little (I dip two fingers in) to be good for the whole day. If you have super thick hair (or long), and you use a lot, then you'll just have to wash a few more times. Also, you might want to consider a different wax, as the pink is designed for short length hair. I currently use green. It works well with medium to long hair, and is effective with short hair too (for me at least).

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Lodge Color ECSGP33 Enameled Cast Iron Square Grill Pan, Caribbean Blue, 10-inch", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: My pan has some dark patches between the ridges. Can anyone tell me if its possible to damage the surface of this pan by cleaning it wrong? Thanks!
Response:
output_field: You shouldn't be able to. The coating on this pan is baked on; I scrub mine pretty hard when I clean it. Since it's cast iron, the only way you *could* (not likely) damage it is if you somehow removed the coating on the ridges. If you did, you would be exposing the bare cast iron underneath. A simple test would be to soak the pan in water for some time then dump the water out and let it air dry. If you see rust anywhere, you have an issue. Again, I really can't imagine that's the case though, and you may just have some baked-on debris between the ridges.

input_field:
Instruction: In light of the product "Honeywell  RTH7600D Touchscreen 7-Day Programmable Thermostat" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: Does this need a C wire or does it run on batteries?
Output:
output_field: This does not need a C wire. It uses two AA batteries. Honeywell (and others such as Trane) use a C wire on models that use WiFi or voice recognition or Z-wave so they can have a 24V connection. All thermostats use low voltage from the other connectors and typically use the batteries as a backup when there's no C wire. For this thermostat, you can take it off the wall, hold it in your hands and program it. You can't do that on models that don't use batteries. However, those other models can be programmed from a computer or phone app so it's less necessary.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Behringer NU6000DSP iNuke Ultra-Lightweight, High-Density 6000-Watt Power Amplifier with DSP Control and USB Interface" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: Hi, I have 2 JBL JRX225 loudspeakers and 2 JBL 218s subwoofers. Can i use this INUKE 6000 to run this whole setup? Or would you suggest a better way?
Output:
output_field: Yes run amp in stereo mode. Come out of main board through a crossover. Hi end from crossover will go to input on one side of amp. the out of that side of amp (R or L) to speaker. then daisy chain speaker ( input into 1 speak then output from same speak to input of other speaker. Repeat the same for the low end from crossover to input of other side of amp. that amp should have plenty of power for those speakers. Good luck

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Kodak 8367849 Combo Ink Cartridge" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: How do I get the ink cartridge out of the printer? It's stuck!
Output:
output_field: Try this. grasp the sides of the ink cartridge firmly and the press the front top clip on the cartridge till you can pull it straight up. If that doesn't work do the same (pressing front top clip on the cartridge) and jiggle the sides of the cartridge and at the same pulling up gently until it breaks lose. It's also possible to remove the print head but that can be done by squeezing the two clips at the back top of the print head and lifting. I would avoid this unless it's absolutely necessary because you may have to replace the print head once removed. Just be careful and work gently with the information described above. Good luck.

Input: I want to transfer embroidery patterns onto cotton t-shirts and have the tracing wash out after sewing. Think this will work?
Output:
output_field: The crayola fabric crayons are not designed to wash out after being ironed onto a shirt. As for actually applying the crayon directly onto the shirt, it would not work that well and the crayons are not designed for that anyway - they are designed to be applied to paper then ironed onto a cloth item. It sounds like you need a product designed specifically for embroidery. There are two products I am aware of for this purpose. the first is a pen with actual disappearing ink - you trace and within a few hours the ink has disappeared (http://www.amazon.com/Collins-vanishing-disappearing-fabric-marker/dp/B001W2M2WO/ref=sr_1_4?s=arts-crafts&ie=UTF8&qid=1377646526&sr=1-4&keywords=embroidery+ink+pen OR http://www.amazon.com/Singer-Fabric-Marking-Pen-Pencil/dp/B00566E680/ref=sr_1_2?s=arts-crafts&ie=UTF8&qid=1377646567&sr=1-2&keywords=embroidery+ink+pen OR http://www.amazon.com/Singer-Point-Disappearing-Marking-Purple/dp/B003BRX6PK/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1377646511&sr=8-1&keywords=embroidery+ink+pen. the other product will wash out after a wash or two (http://www.amazon.com/DMC-U1539-Embroidery-Transfer-Blue/dp/B000W5HTX4/ref=sr_1_5?ie=UTF8&qid=1377646660&sr=8-5&keywords=embroidery+ink+pen). I hope these links help.

input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "Kuretake No. 8 Fountain Brush Pen" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: how do you refill ink
Answer:
output_field: Kuretake makes replacement ink cartridges. Unscrew the body of the pen (the longer part) from the tip (the black grip and brush part-the part that fits into the cap). Remove empty cartridge. Take the new cartridge and push it in with the metal ball side down towards the brush. It'll click, you'll feel when the cartridge is in place. Screw pen back together. It may take a bit for the ink to flee if you haven't used it in a bit. You can run the brush tip under water if you think dried ink is blocking the flow. Almost all the Kuretake pens use the same cartridge from the company. You can buy refills online. The Pentel ones do NOT fit this pen.

Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Auto Ventshade 194101 In-Channel Ventvisor, 4 Piece", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: after 24 hours, my windows are still hitting the edges? Any suggestions? File the edge? Dodge RAM 1500 SLT Quad.
Response:
output_field: If you are referring to the front windows, I would have two suggestions. #1 Run your finger inside the window channel, pressing firmly on the back part (opposite side of the tape). I had to press extremely hard to make sure there were no gaps between the tape and the molding it attaches to. #2 On the front tip of the window guard, make sure it is firmly seated behind the trim piece for the mirror. That is was caused my windows to rub the guards, once I adjusted that, it got alot better. However, the back rain guards always rubbed a little. Hope this helps.

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "Chrome Finish Economical Chair with Chrome Teardrop Footrest, Casters and Glides", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: Is this a good size chair for a women, I am 5 '4" and 130 lbs, or is this chair built for a man where the depth of the seat to the back rest is large.
Output:
output_field: It's probably pretty good for you. The height is adjustable with a minimum of 24 inches. I have mine at 33 inches and my wife who's 5'7" has to jump up on it. I have too as well, but not much. If it were her chair then it would of course be lower. The bottom cushion has a depth at the center of 18 inches, pretty standard seat size. The left/right front edges are less deep at about 17 inches or so. The seat back is 16 inches high. Pretty decent for me (I'm 5'9") but higher would be nicer. The seat back is not adjustable. So basically the seat itself is very standard, the cushions are well made. I've used it pretty much every day for the past 18 months and it shows no sign of wear. I use it at a standing desk so I can switch between sitting and standing throughout the day. I would highly recommend this chair.

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "Ethernet Cable 50 Ft for Internet, Routers and Xbox 360 - White" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: Does cable length affect ping?
Response:
output_field: Not in actuality, no. Ping is a measurement of how fast data travels along the internet pathways to the server and back. This data is transmitted in the form of electricity, which is traveling at very fast speeds. An average internet connection spans hundreds of miles between the server location and the user, and typically only sees ping around 40 milliseconds (1/1000th of a second). The additional 50 feet of this cable produces no measurable effect on you internet ping and speeds, especially in relation to the scale of things.

input_field:
Instruction: In light of the product "Matcha Green Tea Powder - ORGANIC - All Day Energy - Green Tea Lattes - Smoothies - Matcha Baking - Superior Antioxidant Content - Improved Hair & Skin Health- Exclusive to Amazon" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: I would like to know WHERE IN JAPAN are these green tea leaves cultivated? And by what method? For example, are they grown in shade or in the sun?
Output:
output_field: Our Matcha powder is from China and it is not shade-grown. We sent these samples to a lab in Colorado to have them tested. Most brands won't do the testing because it's expensive - but it's important to us. We chose the farm that had the purest (and nutritionally most potent) green tea we could find anywhere. It just so happened to be from a farm in China. The locals have a long and storied tradition of cultivating high quality tea plants. They take a lot of pride in their plantation and meticulously care for each plant. There are some concerns with radiation from Japanese products right now. Since the devastating tsunami in 2004 damaged nuclear reactors in Japan, large portions of their green tea crops have been quarantined, destroyed, or ordered not to be harvested by the Japanese government. It's a tragic situation that has affected the supply of matcha and other teas all over the world. Thanks again for your interest and if you need anything else, please feel free to contact us via Amazon or through jessica@kissmeorganics.com Jessica Patterson Customer Love Specialist KissMeOrganics.com

Instruction：Based on the product "Weber 721001 Smokey Mountain Cooker 18-1/2-Inch Charcoal Smoker, Black"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：How do you season the smoker? And how do you start the charcoal?
Output：
output_field: I have not seasoned the smoker per say. I use lump wood charcoal for smoking. In the manual it says that it is not recommended and they say use briquets which I think suck. I buy a nice brand of lump charcoal and build a small pyramid by hand on the grate big chunks at the bottom so the small pieces don't fall through. Then I bought some sawdust / candle wax mixture firestarters and I use of couple of those to get my coals. Once I have a nice bed of coals going I add the body and the lid to make sure I have temp. Then I put in the water and the meat and it does the rest of the work. I make sure to not use anything that has any chemicals in it. My coals are lump charcoal and then I throw a few cherry chunks on there.

Response:
output_field: Hello fellow Amazon buyer! I have this coffee pot and like it a lot. I pour boiling water into the porcelain pot before making coffee. The pot heats up and when I am ready to pour through, I empty the hot water from the pot into my coffee cup. The result is coffee that is actually hotter than coffee made in electric coffee pots that are boiling water drop by drop. In electric pots, the water loses the heat rapidly. So, it is possible to get a very hot, fresh cup of coffee from the Melitta. However, the heat does dissipate. I use a dishtowel to cover the pot if any coffee is going to sit for a while. I hope that I have answered your question! I do recommend the coffee maker.

input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "Duke Fountain Pen Interchangeable Calligraphy Pen Leather Pen Case Set" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: I've never used a pen lke this before. Will you tell me how to putthis pen together & I have cartidges but I don't know how to put it all together?
Answer:
output_field: Check out the photos on the Amazon product page. Although the photos show a converter, this fits into the nib unit in exactly the same way as a cartridge. Simply, but gently, push the smallest end of the cartridge into the opening behind the threaded portion of the nib unit so that the nipple inside the unit pierces the membrane at the tip of the cartridge. You may have to wait a moment or two for the ink to get through - a couple of quick but gentle downward shakes usually does the trick (but don't bang the nib down on the paper to start the inkflow!), or you can even give the cartridge a slight squeeze if necessary. Sounds much harder than it actually is! Just check the photos for how the pen looks disassembled and have a play around. Easy.

Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Alfred's Teach Yourself to Play Ukulele, Complete Starter Pack", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: I would like to have something like this as a beginner instrument for a 3 year old. Is this suitable (size-wise)? Also, it says it is soprano. I noticed there are "concert", "tenor" etc ukuleles. Is "soprano" the norm? What's the difference?
Response:
output_field: For a beginner the Soprano will be a good Ukulele. It is lighter and produces good sound with a little strumming, which will suit a 3 year old better. The other types that you mentioned, i.e. concert, tenor and baritone are heavier and has more frets and longer stem which will be hard for a 3 year old to handle. You can get the starter soprano Ukulele with instructions very cheap. You need to buy a tuner to go with it to make sure the uke is always tuned before playing. If it does not work with your 3 year old, it might work for you and you might like it. The most commonly used chords are very easy to learn.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Mail Boss 7174 Townhouse Locking Wall Mount Mailbox" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: Where does the outgoing mail go? Does the mail carrier see it easily?
Output:
output_field: The red "flag" on the side can be pulled out indicating there's outgoing mail. On mine, the mailman would NOT need a key. There are two doors on this box: the locked bottom compartment, and the unlocked hinged top door (it's the section on the pic of the box where "U.S. MAIL" is written. The postal worker opens the top unlocked door, and tosses the mail in where it falls into the locked compartment. There is a large clip visible right behind the top unlocked door panel for OUTGOING mail to be wedged under . With the red flag out (and especially if mail is being delivered) the postal worker will easily see it. Again, no one including the mail carrier, will need a key to get your outgoing mail, assuming it fits in the top compartment where the letter clip is. However, since no one will need a key to access your outgoing mail, ANYONE can get to your outgoing mail (but this is the case for most private mailboxes). My only issue with this mailbox is that it seems to attract a lot of bills, but I'm shopping around for a filter for this problem.

output_field: Not sure that you can since roasting is a dry heat method where the heat in the oven surrounds the food. If you turned the unit on saut and tried to roast something, it would be like tring to roast something on a pot on the stovetop -- that method isn't roasting.

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "Borla 140496 Cat-Back Exhaust System" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: Anyone get a rattle after install?
Response:
output_field: I have had this unit on my car for over 10,000 miles and not a single rattle. If you are getting a rattle, let the system settle in for a little while (i.e., put couple hundred miles of driving on). After which you will want to re-adjust the fit re-tighten the bolts. In my case I found that immediately after the initial install the system looked perfect (alignment with cutouts was near perfect). However after driving for a few days the system moved a little. I simply loosened the bolts and re-adjusted. I've noticed that over the past 10K miles the passenger side exit is slightly off-center in the cut out, but it is not immediately obvious (you have to be looking for it), so I've left the system alone. But this adjustment process did convince me that the system definitely needs a re-tightening after initial driving. (I did not use a torque wrench to tighten to a specified torque but I did tighten this down very hard... maybe a little over-torqued... but it's all good).

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Drill Doctor DD750X Drill Bit Sharpener" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: Are there angle adjustments to accommodate sharpening bits for use on stainless steel on any Drill Doctor Models??
Output:
output_field: I can only speak for the DD750X that I have and it can grind 118 and 140 angle drills with the latter being better for tougher materials like stainless. The 750 is the only model that goes to 140, the 500 goes only to 135 so the 750 is the better choice if drilling tough materials is important to you. Clearance (relief) angle is the other important variable in grinding a drill point. The 750 does have adjustability but I don't recall exactly what the limits are right now, but it is adjustable. The best thing to do is go to the Drill Doctor website and look at the user manual and the drill angle guides they have there. Even if the DD can't get the exact geometry you're after it will give you a good symmetrical starting point for a final touch-up on a grinding wheel. Hope that helps.

Instruction：Based on the product "Corsair Vengeance K70 Mechanical Gaming Keyboard - Black Cherry MX Red (CH-9000011-NA)"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：What dose the BIOS switch do on the top of the keyboard?
Output：
output_field: The BIOS switch both adjusts the polling rate and allows you to turn off advanced keyboard features for compatibility with certain motherboard BIOS and KVM switches. Settings of 1, 2, 4, and 8 are millisecond polling rates (1ms = 1000hz). Switching to BIOS reduces the polling rate and turns off other features for maximum compatibility. By default we ship at 1ms (1000Hz) and most gamers will prefer to just use the setting. from http://forum.corsair.com/v3/showthread.php?t=118655

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Colorant 1-Pound Blue Cement and Grout Pigment" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: Will this work with unsanded grout for glass tiles on a shower wall? if so, how much would I need to color a 9 lb bag for a light to medium blue?
Answer:
output_field: yes, it works with any grout. Since you would not be mixing all of the grout at once what I do is measure out the amount I want to mix for the time(say 6 cups of grout) then I color that amount by adding the colorant at a measuring spoon amount until I reach the color I want. Only you can tell how deep you want the grout color. (It will also dry a bit lighter) So If you start mixing and added a teaspoon and it's too light, add another measure until it looks right. I have done some large projects (table tops) and this works great. you might make yourself a note as you add the color. I have never done this by the pound measuring. Seems to me that a little color goes a long way! Just depends on how intense a color you need to achieve. hope this helps. Relax and have fun.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Corsair Vengeance M65 Performance FPS Gaming Mouse, Gunmetal Black (CH-9000022-NA)" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: Which is better M60 or M65? I heard some complaints about M65 acceleration,iso I want to know which one you recommend, especially for gaming?
Output:
output_field: First off, the two mice are physically similar; except for maybe less than an ounce of weight difference. The button placement is identical, as well as the ergonomics. Aside from the M65's better DPI, I don't see any differences in specs (at least on paper). I haven't felt any acceleration or "floaty" quality with this mouse, though I don't play roles that require absolute pixel-accuracy. This mouse has been great for my lazy grip, which is a half way point between palming and griping the mouse. While it may sound odd, I have another mouse plugged -- a Logitech G502. That is perfect for a claw grip and works best for me when I want to change up how I play. --- ADDITION --- After doing a bit of reading, I found out both the m60 and m65 have 3-5% positive acceleration (and can't be turned off). I suppose I've adapted to it though since it's a common thing in most mice I own, apparently.

Instruction: Using the details of the product "Taymac MM710C Weatherproof Single Outlet Cover Outdoor Receptacle Protector, 4-3/4 Inches Deep, Clear" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: When would you use the 2-2/3 Inches Deep model of this receptacle vs this 4-3/4 Inch model? Thanks.
Response:
output_field: I'm not certain which model I have, but it is certainly deeper than 2-2/3 inches. If there are only two models, then I have the 4-3/4-inch model. I installed a double GFCI safety receptacle in a weatherproof box, with the pivoting, liftable cover over the receptacle. I use the lower socket as a semi-permanent power source for an electric water fountain, keeping the cover closed in case of rain, with the power line exiting from an opening at the bottom of the cover. The upper socket is utilized with the cover lifted for temporary use of power tools. Since I use heavy electric extensions, the plugs and lines take up a lot of room, and I needed the 4-3/4-inch cover to readily accommodate them. If you will be using a single 18-gauge extension, the 2-2/3-inch model should suffice. But if you plan to use heavy extension lines, I would definitely recommend the 4-3/4-inch model. I would also recommend waterproof caulking around or between section joints.

Instruction: In light of the product "Freedom No-Pull Dog Harness Training Package with Leash" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: Is this harness safe to use to tether a dog to a seatbelt using the back ring?
Output:
output_field: Is it safe to use for tethering a dog to a seatbelt using the back ring? I don't believe this product was ever designed for that purpose. The straps are not that wide, so if the dog were to be restrained during an accident, I don't imagine that it would feel too good for the dog. My answer for that would have to be NO. I will say, that the intended purpose for use with dogs that pull has worked wonderfully for my 9 month old boxer dog. Of course, having an excellent trainer direct us didn't hurt either, but this harness is comfortable for dogs and works. I would definitely recommend this harness and proper positive reinforcement techniques together to correct pulling.

Instruction: Referencing the product "Versace Pour Homme By Versace Eau-de-toilette Spray, 3.4 Ounce", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: Does this cologne smell better than Versace Eau Fraiche? Also, Are the colognes sold by Amazon (not third party sellers) non-fakes?
Output:
output_field: I tested both (one on one wrist and the other on the other), and found Frache to be lighter and not as "complex" (in my opinion) as L'Homme. I also noted the amount of time the scent lasted before they can no longer be detected (which was the better part of 18 hours). Then when I received L'Homme from Amazon, I again timed the length of persistance of the scent and was satisfied that it lasted the same length of time - indicating to me that I had received the real "mccoy". I can not vouch for every distrubutor but look at user comments for each vendor - I have found this to be very reliable. Good Luck - and I hope I have helped you in your decision.

Instruction: In light of the product "TrimmerPlus GC720 Add-On Cultivator (Discontinued by Manufacturer)" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: Will this tiller churn up dying sod? I need to dig up and replace a section of grass and would prefer to not dig it up with a shovel--approx. 4" deep
Output:
output_field: Hello, I have used this tiller with a troy built weed trimmer in my gardens without any stalling. One of the gardens has a sandy soil and enables the tiller to go about three inches deep. The other garden has a clay base soil and tills somewhat harder but will still go about three inches deep. Going through old sod will be difficult due to the grass wrapping surround the tines causing you to have to stop and remove the grass so that the tiller can contact the soil. My advice would be to spray the area with a grass killer and rake the area before tilling. Mike

Instruction: Concerning the product "Cardinal Gates Banister Shield 15' Roll Clear", answer the query provided below.
Question: Could this be used to enclose a TV stand in my living room or would it be too bendy to be useful?
Answer:
output_field: It might work. It's very flexible left to right (so you can wrap it around something), but not as much top to bottom (fairly stiff that way). If the material is fixed to something on both sides (left and right edges), I don't think a small child would be able to press buttons, etc., through the material. But being able to affix it something on both edges is fairly critical. One other thing to keep in mind with small kids -- the edges can be quite sharp when cut, if not cut smoothly.

Instruction: Pertaining to the product "NYX Jumbo Eye Pencil Shadow Liner 604 Milk", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: Is the milk a warmer or cooler white? Is it more cream or more blue-ish white tone?
Response:
output_field: What an excellent question! It looks to me to be cool to neutral. The name "Milk" is perfect for it, because it is the color of milk. It isn't blue at all, but it is cool. However, it works great of my warm toned, yellow based skin, so it is somewhat neutral. Something I should have mentioned before, it is not the kind of pencil that should be used if you want something white in your eye look. It's not that it isn't pigmented, it is, it just works much better as a base rather than something you'd wear on it's own. It does show up enough to be a highlight, but because I am very pale, the color gets a little lost on my skin. It will show up better on people with medium to dark skin tones. I hope this helps!

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "MindWare Imaginets", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: How does this compare to Tangoes Junior?
Output:
output_field: Short answer: Tangrams is to Imaginets what the Rubik's Cube is to Jenga Blocks. Long answer: Tangoes Junior is a simplified form of Tangram, also known has Chinese Puzzles, is on the same loose lines as this. However, for a kid under 5 years old, I would personally recommend this over Tangrams / Tangoes - simply because it is easier to work with. Chinese puzzles rely on re-creating a shadow figure, and have a constraint of a fixed number of pieces (7 pieces). The objective of that game is to figure out, based on the shadow figure, how the 7 pieces fit beside each other to form the shape. Imaginets has no such intelligent claims. There are many more pieces, in their full color glory, and the objective is not so much of a puzzle but just the joy of creation.

Instruction: Based on the product "Dc 24v 15a Switching Power Supply Transformer Regulated" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.

Answer:
output_field: Mine is marked 1-9 left to right looking at the power strip connections 1,2,3=V+ 4,5,6=V- 7=Frame, safety ground - bare or green or green-yellow 8=Neutral, White 9=Active, Black (or sometimes Red), this is the switched line if you have a single pole on/off switch (it's shown as "L" or Live in the decal) Supply output (24v) is floating so you can ground (if required) either the V+ or V-

Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Garmin MapSource TOPO! US 24k West Topographic Coverage for Washington, Oregon, California, and Nevada (DVD)" answer the inquiry below.
Input: Does it come with hiking and trail maps? Otherwise, can you overlay trail maps? Looking mainly at California
Output:
output_field: It is a Topo map - but there are some trails. My experiences with it in Tennessee, Colorado, and Montana is that some trails are there, others aren't. It is sometimes surprising what will be there and the things that are not. If you intend to hike a national park, for example, it might be worthwhile to purchase a map for that specific park. For example, you can purchase from the Trailhead series. There's one for the Pacific Crest Trail, if that helps. Regarding a trail overlay - If you intend to load the Topo onto your GPS you need to check to see if it can handle the additional info. I use the Basecamp software from Garmin (free download) and with it you can install overlay information. You can also overlay aerial photography.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "3M 7162 Full-Facepiece Spray Paint Respirator - Organic Vapor" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: I can't find my instruction booklet on how to clean inside and care of the plastic. any one know
Answer:
output_field: plain or distilled water for the majority of cleanimg, or a 70-91% Isopropyl alcohol for the rubber around the seal to clean off skin oils Depending on what you need to clean. Don't use anything that will attack the plastic. Plain water for the face shield, high pressure air for the nook and crannies. Also be sure not to over use the filters and make sure you get the correct ones for what you are srpaying. Don't use any car cleaning products for plastics. maybe the clorox wipe pads, but make sure to test and if no rash appears on your skin, it likely will be ok. I say this as when you have it on you don't want any vapors being trapped in there with your face and eyes. Any other perto based cleaner may attack the plastic, ie break down the polymers and them the seal fails. Worse case buy a new mask and ask is the health of my eyes and lungs worth the cost?

input_field:
Instruction: In light of the product "Hobbyware Pattern Maker Cross Stitch Software -Standard Version-Version 4.0" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: I am new to this- I have a poem along with a couple of pictures- does this software program allow me to insert this and out comes a colored coded piec
Output:
output_field: Yes. What you do is select "text" (icon is T). Then you select the font you like; the numbers signify the number of sts in the height of the capital letters (lower case are shorter, of course). Some of the fonts come with options in the height (such as 8 and 13). Now click in the upper L (or wherever you want) of the empty grid and start typing your poem. As to the picture, I think you mean can you scan and import. Yes. Be aware that the piece will come out in several hundred colors (with their appropriate symbols). This will be way too many. Manually condense the colors to simplify and shorten stitching time. I like no more than 25 colors; YMMV. If you keep all the colors, you'll have to use blended needles for some of the colors. (I hate doing this! Ugh. My mom is ok with blended needles...) mb

Instruction: Concerning the product "Orange Head CREE XM-L T6 LED Zoom Flashlight Torch(With Batteries and Charger)", answer the query provided below.

Answer:
output_field: This is a second answer to the same question; generally no flashlight will illuminate anything at or mile with any intensity, regardless what the manufacture may claim. But this small flashlight is one powerful item; generally speaking I would estimate that at a distance of 200 to 500 feet away, it would light up most every thing in your view. With two batteries supplied there is plenty of power, but I would suggest ordering an extra two batteries that only cost about $8.00 extra. There is nothing better than having two extra fully charged batteries when your power is running low. A GREAT flashlight for a LOW COST.

Instruction: Referencing the product "Oxy-Sorb 100-Pack Oxygen Absorber, 100cc", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: I PURCHASED OXY SORB 100CC had no knowledge of use of. Opened pack took some out.. Unused ones got hot & indicator purple. R they now bad
Output:
output_field: If you didn't reseal the package in something air-tight ( like a jar) then they are probably bad. You can test if you fill a jar with something simple ( rice, beans, etc) and put one or more in, seal the jar, and see if the lid "pops" down via vacuum pressure- That would indicate the rest are still probably good. However, I also found with mine that a lot of them were not good from the get-go, even after keeping them in an airtight jar.

Instruction：Based on the product "Kenwood KDC-BT958HD CD Receiver with Built-In Bluetooth & HD Radio"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：With the kenwood music control app will I be able to control my Moto X with either the bluetooth or the USB connection?
Output：
output_field: The Kenwood app sucks, and isn't worth installing. It only allows you play music stored locally on the phone, and won't work with 3rd party players like Google Play Music, Amazon Music or any podcast or streaming services. The Bluetooth audio streaming works well for all of those things though, and the built in support for Pandora is top notch. It's a great stereo and I've been very happy with it, but the Kenwood app is next to useless, and thankfully isn't required. If you want to try the Kenwood app on your phone before buying, you can get it from the play store, but like I mentioned it is next to useless, and the built in bluetooth audio streaming is superior.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Jeweler's Diamond Testing Pieces-Professional Loupe and Electronic Diamond Tester Machine", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: How do you use it? It doesnt come with instructions.
Response:
output_field: If the diamond looks to be about 1/10th of a Carat or larger, put it on dial setting 4 (the lights will light up to #4. If it is smaller, set the dial at 6. After setting the dial, take off the cap and press the thin metal nose directly against the top of the diamond. Be careful not to touch the metal prongs, for this will give you a false reading. If it is a diamond, all the lights will light up (even the red ones) and it will beep. If that doesn't happen, it's not a diamond. I recommend that you test something that you know is a diamond to get the hang of it.

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Tetra SafeStart Water Treatment" answer the inquiry below.
Input: The 8.45 oz.bottle pictured states it treats up to 500 gallons but you state it only treats 70 gallons. Which is correct?
Output:
output_field: It depends on how you are using it. They have 2 suggested uses on the bottle, which result in different dosage rates. It will treat 70 gallons if you are starting a tank from scratch and need to establish a new biological system for breaking down ammonia. They also suggest you can add small amounts of this product when doing water changes as a maintenance routine. This dosage rate would treat 500 gallons. However, this seems mostly pointless to me as changing the water (even 100% of it) doesn't remove any significant portion of the beneficial bacteria from the tank. They primarily live on surfaces (filter, gravel, decorations, etc), so even replacing all of the water won't matter. This might make sense to dose if you have to replace all your filter media at once, as that would remove a noticeable portion of your bacteria and would speed re-population of the filter. (ie: if you have a cartridge-based hang-on-back filter that doesn't have a separate bio stage...) So it treats "up to 500" gallons, but only as at maintenance routine levels.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Cashmere Mist By Donna Karan For Women. Eau De Parfum Spray 1.7 Oz / 50 Ml" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: are you going to send me the real thing? I don't want a knock off.
Answer:
output_field: The reason people are saying it seems "watered down" is because they don't read what they are buying or are clearly just uneducated to how perfume is classified. It clearly states in the description that it is Eau de toilette. Higher quality brands have 2 versions: Eau de toilette (EDT) & Eau de parfum (EDP). The "parfum" version is what most people consider perfume and what a woman would wear on a date, it is 10 and 20 percent oil. "Eau de toilette" versions are usually less than 10 percent oil and provide a lighter, slightly less complex scent than an EDP does. It is designed that way to be more for everyday use. If you are comparing perfumes, make sure you are comparing the same versions, not EDT vs EDP. Most department stores will sample a stronger EDP and offer the weaker EDT at a sale price.

Instruction: Concerning the product "Sennheiser EW 100 ENG G3-A omni-directional clip-on microphone kit system", answer the query provided below.
Question: does this have two wireless mics? and can I connect it to my zoom h4n at the same time as a boom mic?
Answer:
output_field: There is one wireless lavalier mic, one transmitter, one receiver, and a that second transmitter that you plug into an xlr connector on your regular mic. You can only use either the lavalier and transmitter OR the second transmitter attached to a regular mic at a time or you would need another receiver. However, I have my Sennheiser e935 plugged into the second transmitter and that sends signals to the receiver which is attached to my Zoom h6n. I can also run other wired mics, instruments, keyboards etc. to the Zoom h6n but only one mic wirelessly via the Sennheiser transmitter. I don't know about your Zoom h4n but the h6n can handle 4 additional mics plus the Sennheiser transmitter.

Output:
output_field: My hair is medium brown and I leave my in anywhere from 5-8 hours. I've heard of people leaving it in for even longer. The choice is yours, though I recommend leaving it in for at least 4 hours, but don't forget to wrap your hair in plastic wrap right after henna application. The heat and moisture facilitate the plant's permeation of the hair shaft. Since both hair and the henna are organic in origin, I would think a longer processing time would allow for better results in terms of color. Cheers!

Input: I am looking at buying this for a town and country what else do I need to buy? Some module thing? or is this all I need.
Output:
output_field: It depends on the year of your vehicle. You may need a security immobilizer override module such as the DB-ALL or DBALL2. Most vehicles within the last several years require an override. These modules can also simplify the installation. You can check on directechs.com. If you do require one of these modules and are installing this yourself then you will have to find a shop to update the firmware on it specific to your vehicle. Or you can purchase an XKLoader2 (available on-line) and download the firmware from directechs.com yourself. You will need to have a computer with Internet Explorer browser to use the XKLoader2.

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Brother XL2600I Sew Advance Sew Affordable 25-Stitch Free-Arm Sewing Machine" answer the inquiry below.
Input: how do you fill the bobbin
Output:
output_field: The bobbin is filled in the "traditional" way -- not in the bobbin case. You put the bobbin on the little post on the right on the top of the machine, push it to the right to disengage the needle from going up and down, thread the thread through the hole in the top of the bobbin, and start the machine. When the bobbin is full, you remove it and put it in the bobbin case, beneath the plate by the presser foot, and return the bobbin-winding post to the left position, which re-engages the sewing action.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Forum Novelties HK-C001 Electric Shocking Gag Pen" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: How do u shock people?
Answer:
output_field: When someone clicks the pen, it completes the circuit to the metal at the top. It's not painful; just startling. There's a battery inside. There is also a false ball point on the end, so it looks as if could function as a real pen but it doesn't. So, when a person clicks the end of pen to extend the ball point, they get a shock. The pen looks cheap, but people don't usually hand expensive pens to other people.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Crane Adorable Ultrasonic Cool Mist Humidifier with 2.1 Gallon Output per Day - Cow" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: No Filter: So Is It Safe? So are these, without filters, safe?
Output:
output_field: Yes, they are safe without filters, filters are not needed for that reason in ultrasonic humidifiers. Why you should be using filtered or distilled water anyway is because of the DEPOSITS that collect on the ultrasonic disk at the bottom (heart?) of the unit. When too much mineral deposit forms on the disk, it will stop working. That's also why you sometimes get a little brush with this type of humidifiers, but those are not very effective I've found: I have lost two units to this before I figured out the problem with the deposits. Now I use either boiled and cooled water, or filtered water. Knock on wood, that has kept it running for many winters!

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "Leisure Time 45450 Jet Clean", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: What are the directions for use? Is an entire bottle used to clean a 250 gallon spa?
Output:
output_field: I just bought this from a local dealer yesterday. He said to use 1/2 bottle for my 250 gallon spa. Here are the directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE Hot tubs and spas: Use every 3 months or when spa is drained and refilled per the Simple Spa Care Program: 1. Remove filter and clean separately using Filter Clean. 2. Before spa is drained, add 1 bottle of Jet Clean to warm spa water. 3. Turn ON pump and run jets for 15 minutes. (Ensure that filter is not in spa). 4. Turn pump and jets OFF and let sit for 1 hour. 5. Turn pump ON and run jets and blower for 15 minutes. 6. Drain spa, hosing off inside spa walls while draining. 7. Refill spa according to the Simple Spa Care Program. *May need to partially fill spa and drain to help reduce foaming. NOTE: Some residual foaming may occur. If so, use Defoamer to suppress the foam. Jetted Bath Tubs: 1. Pour 8 oz (1/2 bottle) in tub with warm water before draining. 2. Turn jets ON for 15 minutes 3. Drain and rinse tub with clean water.

Inside measurements - portion the birds will occupy: front to back: 3 1/4", height: 5" in front, 6" in back (roof slopes). Should be 1 1/8", that extra little bit makes a big difference.

input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "truRoots Organic Quinoa 100% Whole Grain Premium Quality, 4 lbs" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: One reviewer mentioned saponins. Does this contain saponins?
Answer:
output_field: From what I have read, saponins are the dusty coating on quinoa. If you don't rinse quinoa, it can have a funny taste. I make quinoa all the time, and my family loves it. However, I always rinse it very well, even if it says that it is pre rinsed. Quinoa needs to be flavored with your favorite spices, or oils. I love it mixed with 1/2 of a Hass avocado, a little sea salt, and chipotle pepper flakes. The very first time I tried quinoa, I hated it. I tried it again with flavorings, and sauteed vegetables and fell in love. You can make it ahead, portion it off in serving sized containers, and you can have a quick lunch, with add ons such as toasted nuts, avocado, or sauteed veggies. It should last about a week in the fridge. Enjoy.

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "Samsung Gear 2 Neo Smartwatch - Orange" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: how long is the battery life with medium usage? will it last me two days? Not light usage or heavy usage, just using it as an everyday tool.
Response:
output_field: In short...... Yes, it should. In long...... I am a day and well, lets say 3/4's. I'm almost at 2 day's. I got the watch on Tuesday, fully charged it, put it on at 1pm. it has not left me since. I have used it fairly moderately. Made several calls. Tons of txts, Loads of notifications email/gmail/txt/calander/alarms. It has been connected to note 3 the entire time. I did power cycle it one time due to another issue. O, i did take it off for about 20 min while me and my wife got into the Hot Tub (i know its water proof, but didnt wanna risk the heat). While we where in the hot tub, i attached it to charging cradle. So Right now it is 1155 am Thursday, so lets call it a day and 23hours, and i have 70% battery. So in 2 day's with 1 power cycle, and 1 20-25 min charging session, i still have 70%. I think that is very reasonable. Now if i can get the one problem i am having straightened out, i will be good to go.

Query: Will these mats will fit a 2007 Dodge Ram 1500 Crew Cab (Laramie trim)?
Response:
output_field: Yes, these floor mats should fit directly into your truck, like a glove, based upon my experience with my 2002 Dodge Ram 1500 SLT Quad Cab where they fit almost perfect except only one very small area on the driver's mat not hugging the transmission wall. Note, the third generation ( 2002-2008 ) of Dodge Ram 1500 trucks essentially made most body and other engine parts identical for the years 2002-2008 with very few exceptions (E.G. headlights, engine size, etc...). Also, there are many "purists" who say that the QUAD Cab on the third generation is not a true "crew" cab, based upon dimensions, however Dodge did not make the "MegaCab" (Read: "True" Crew Cab) for the Ram 1500 available as an option until the fourth generation (years 2009 and on). Sorry to be so technical but there are distinctions.

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "No. 25 Moist White Art Clay, 50 lbs. per Pack - 45015Y / AAC45015Y", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: so this clay can be air dried? I'm sorry I am a beginner and this will be my first clay purchase
Output:
output_field: This clay will become 'Bone Dry' then can be fired in a kiln. The clay will be very brittle in an air dry state. Once it's fired the clay will be transformed into a hard, low-fire quartz state. Then you can apply glaze and fire again. We use this clay for wheel throwing and making ceramics.

input_field:
Instruction: Concerning the product "Pet Gear Travel-Lite Tri-Fold Pet Ramp for cats and dogs up to 200-pounds, Pet Ramp, Chocolate/Black", answer the query provided below.
Question: Has anyone used one of these with a Transport? My pitbull is having trouble getting in and out of the truck these days, being that he's going on 12.
Answer:
output_field: Yes, we use it all the time. Takes some getting used to for the dog. Very large dogs, you need to be careful , our Rottie has slipped off a few times. We had to teach her to slow down and stood along the sides instead of just trusting her the walk up. A steep incline is not good either, we have a large truck. Plus side is that it is light weight, easy to lift. Folds up nicely. Not slippery, with the sandpaper coating. Don't plan on the sandpaper staying pretty, their toe nails are rough on it. Overall I would say, training, watch the incline, back up to a curb, if possible. If as been a great addition, for our elder dogs.

Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Washburn RO10 Rover Steel String Travel Acoustic Guitar - Natural)", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.

I didnt like the Martin because it does not have a Truss rod to adjust the neck,so if got warped you are out of luck, plus it got some bad reviews.The fit and finish on the rover is very good for the price plus a really great case.l find myself player this little guy more often than my full size guitars it is great for sitting on the couch to practice.With the light gauge strings it has an electric guitar feel. input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "Zippo Hand Warmer High Polish Chrome Pocket Lighter", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: How do you light this thing? Iv'e been holding my lighter on it,counting to ten,and still doesn't start. Thats after filling it up.
Output:
output_field: The first time that you light it the instructions tell you to put the suggested amount of fuel in twce. I am assuming this is because the first time it's filled the wicking keeps it all. I had the same problem the first time I used mine also. I intially added twelve hours worth of fuel and then when it wouldn't start I put it away and the next morning I added another 6 hours of fuel and it started after holding a lighter to it for only a few seconds. Since then it has worked perfectly and only needed the double fill when I first recieved it. I hope this helps. If not I would contact Zippo, I am sure they would help you out.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Oatey 14209 Mystic Rainwater Collection System" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: does this model offer the ability to manually shut off the diverter?
Output:
output_field: Yes! You just disconnect the hose leading to the barrel and then use the provided stopper to plug up the same nozzle leading from the diverter. (The principle on which it works is that, with nowhere to go, the water just builds up inside the diverter and drains as it would normally) You don't need to removed the diverter itself. I like this diverter. So far it's been maintenance free and works VERY effectively. My two rain barrels fill up very quickly and when full, the rain pours down the normal downspout. I would fully recommend this diverter. Make sure you follow the instructions and don't cut out too much of a gap when installing!

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Sennheiser PC 350 Special Edition High Performance Gaming Headset" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: wich is better this or the pc 360
Output:
output_field: The PC350 is CLOSED back meaning they offer pretty good noise cancellation but the sound is isolated within the earcup. The PC360 is OPEN back meaning they leak sound but have a MUCH better soundstage (the perception you gain of where the sound is coming from) than a closed back headset. I have both (PC 350 and PC 360) and the PC 360 wins, hands down. I cannot describe to you the difference between open back and closed back. You just have to experience it for yourself. At first, I thought I wanted a closed back headset (PC 350). Now, having experienced the soundstage presented by an open back headset (PC 360), I am convinced that an open back design is the best.

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "InSinkErator WRN-00 JamBuster Wrenchette", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: I can turn the insinkerator using this, but still stiff, even after turning it a dozen times. I still get hum -no spin- only when turn on. Next steps?
Output:
output_field: Work the wrench back and forth in both directions. If the wrench will not turn easily, it is OK to use some force. Continue working with the wrench until it turns freely in complete circles in both directions. Check the overload protector. The overload protector is located under the sink, on the bottom of the disposer, facing the floor. It is a small red button. If the overload protector has tripped, you will see the red button dropped down. Press the red button. With the disposer powered OFF, check inside the grinding chamber. Look down into the disposer using a flashlight. Do not place your hand into the disposer. If you see anything in the disposer, remove it using tongs or pliers.Turn on the water, then the disposer. The disposer should now run. If the problem is rust or mineral deposits stuck on the blades, you can try a chemical like CLR Calcium Lime Rust Remover. Use it to liquify the mineral deposits and free the blades so they will spin. If the disposer continues to jam, you may need to service or replace it.

Instruction：Based on the product "PEET M10 SafeKeeping Dryer"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：Any opinions if this device or the rod style work better at PREVENTING THE MUSTY SMELL?
Output：
output_field: If you're getting a musty smell, you don't have enough dehumidifying going on. This device works fine by itself keeping my safe dry, but I live in a low humidity area, have central AC which does it's own job keeping moisture in my house low, and I'm not constantly going in and out of my safe. Low humidity is something you can totally go "belt and suspenders" on. Get this, get a glow road, get a rechargeable dehumidifier from eva-dry... you will never make it too dry. To sum up, if you're getting a musty smell, you're not dry enough.

Input: How do the wheels adjust
Output:
output_field: There is a lever attached to the frame. The lever is slotted and is tightened with a pinch nut. Loosen the nut, adjust the frame up or down and then tighten the nut. Easy one person operation. The nut seems to hold tension. Getting the sweep adjusted to just the right height can be a job. Too high and it won't pick anything up, too low and the wheels lock up and drag along. Once I got mine adjusted just right I marked the slot with a stripe of paint.
