Instruction: Based on the product "Snakebyte iDroid:con Rechargeable Bluetooth Game Controller for Android and iOS Devices, Black (SB00696)" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: How do you get this device in pairing mode? My android box doesn't see it at all?
Answer:
output_field: Hold one of the action buttons (A/B/X/Y) for whichever function you want, and then press and hold the power button until the lights on the front flash. Then use your android bluetooth settings to scan for available devices and pair it there. A is keyboard mode (emulators) and X is gamepad mode (supposedly for 3D games, but never works). You have to unpair the device every time you finish with it before you re-search.

Input: Does 3485ED1002B is equivalent to 3485ED1002A?

output_field: As a general rule, when the part numbers are identical except for the last letter, especially from an A to a B, the change of the last letter is to indicate that a newer version has been released. This is much the same as software programs that have updates that are sequentially numbered. This is my experience as a maintenence professional but you could check with a parts professional for insight.

Instruction: Referencing the product "Jeep Wrangler Black Denim W/ Logo Spare Tire Cover 32-33 Inch Mopar OEM", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: I have a Jeep Wrangler (2015) with a spare tire which reads -P225/75R16 04S !Will this cover fit or what size do I need ?
Output:
output_field: Measure the spare tire in inches across the diameter (side to side) and then across the top (front to back). Our spare is 31" side to side and 10.5" across front to back. The other numbers are for aspect ratio and other stuff that doesn't come into play for the cover. And (sadly) has no relationship to the actual vehicle specs since people mess around with that anyway. Hope this helps. We have a 1988 Jeep Wrangler Sahara so car make, model and year don't really come into play at all.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Cambridge Audio DacMagic XS Digital Audio Converter - Headphone Amplifier", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: Does the DacMagic XS sound better than the older & more expensive DacMagic 100? Any other advantage of one over the other?
Response:
output_field: Hi absolut_beethoven: The DacMagic XS was created to offer much better sound than the cheap headphone output installed on most laptop and desktop computers. It is designed to be a portable DAC / headphone amplifier, while the DacMagic 100 is designed to be a part of the home audio system and offer better digital audio conversion than the standard DACs built into most CD/DVD/BluRay players and satellite/cable boxes. The DacMagic uses an ESS9023 24-bit DAC chip while the DacMagic 100 uses the higher quality Wolfson WM8742 24-bit DAC chip. I would say that if you're going to use headphones to listen to your PC/Mac, the DACMagic XS is the way to go. If you're looking for a high quality DAC for your AV system, the DACMagic 100 is the better choice. Thanks, Mike Wheeler Operations Manager AVHiFi

Instruction: Pertaining to the product "PhyCox Soft Chews (120 ct)", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: phycox usage with rimadyl usage: I'm wondering if it's safe to give my dog both rimadyl and phycox?
Response:
output_field: Phycox is a joint supplement, rimadyl is a pain medication. The two serve separate but complimentary functions. Rimadyl has actually been discontinued, although the same medication (but not in chewable format) is now available from a different supplier under a different name. As both rimadyl and the replacement med are available by prescription only, you should get the advice of your veterinarian for your animal, but the concurrent use of the two was recommended by my veterinarian for my eight year old dog with arthritis in his hips.

input_field:
Instruction: Concerning the product "Basement Watchdog BW1050 Sump Pump, 4400 Gallon Per Hour", answer the query provided below.
Question: What is lowest the float switch can be installed? Have 15" betwn the bottom of the pit and the drain tile. Will the float be below the drain tile?
Answer:
output_field: The overall height of the pump is 12". It is not necessary to mount the switch to the pipe coming out of the top unless you have a very narrow diameter opening. If that is the case, the water level will reach 12 to 14" before activating pump. If you have a 10" or greater diameter opening, you can mount the float switch, using a long zip tie, to the top of the pump casing (you can see bracket on top of float switch in picture), the pump will activate at approximately 4.5" water level. You can slide the float switch further down, but the pump will run more often. The float will be below the drain tile. I have two of these used in conjunction with a 12v backup. They were purchased on Amazon and I am a satisfied with them. The float switches are mounted to the casing.

Instruction: Referencing the product "Liposomal Glutathione", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: This product needs to be refrigerated, how do you send it?
Output:
output_field: Empirical Labs, the manufacturer, recommends refrigerating their Liposomal Glutathione AFTER opening. This is to prolong the efficacy, or the shelf life, of the product, not because heat affects it. Once it is opened, as with any natural product, oxidation begins; they recommend using the product within 40 days of breaking the inner seal to receive maximum benefit from the product. Empirical Labs does not use any special shipping such as ice packs because it is not necessary. The Green Pharmacy follows the same shipping procedures as the manufacturer.

Instruction: In light of the product "Microfiber California King Comforter Set, Denim / Smoke Blue" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: Any pet owners out there...how bad does it collect cat/dog hair? I heard microfiber is the best to deal with pet hair.

output_field: I am a pet owner for sure...5 dogs, 9 cats, a couple of the cats and a 2-3 of the dogs will get in bed often. It sheds the hair well, and washes out clean...I would say it does deal with pet hair very well...one of our dogs is a chow shepherd mix and sheds a lot...the others are beagles who don't shed a lot...one of the beagles loves to sleep with us, and she likes to dig a spot before she lays down...the microfiber stands up well to that also. I must say that overall, I am really happy with this comforter, and the real authority, my wife, was skeptical when I bought it, but has remarked several times what a great comforter it is, especially given what we paid for it. Stands up to frequent washing too...and we were skeptical about its warmth in the winter, but found it to be sufficient (we live in Indiana...didn't have a real bad winter last year). Overall a very good product...

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Kyjen Outward Hound Backpack", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: Are there guidelines for how much weight you should put in the pack? Like 5% of the dog's bodyweight? Or...?
Response:
output_field: 20% should be the max weight to give your dog unless (s)he is in top-top shape and/or is a breed meant for hard work. For examble a 5lb Chihuahua probably shouldn't hold more than 1lb max, but an 80lb German Shepherd could hold 16lbs (20%), but in top shape could carry 20-25lbs. It depends on your dog's body fat percentage and athletic ability. Also take into consideration the age and probablility of your dog developing arthritis and if he'll be wearing the pack for long enough to do significant damage to his joints.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Parmak DF-SP-LI Solar Pak 6 Low Impedance 6-Volt Battery-Operated 25-Mile-Range Electric Fence Charger" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: If it's not connected to the fence the meter is in the green and it pops 7,000 volts. When connected the meter goes red and no pop even on terminals
Answer:
output_field: The fence is most likely shorted to ground somewhere. You will have to inspect the fence for the fault and simply repair it. It could be a bad insulator, or it could be as simple as a lot of tall grass and or weeds grounding the fence out over the entire span of wire. The bottom line is, the hot wire that passes through the insulators cannot touch anything but the fence charger and the insulators; if it touches so much as a wooden post it will likely short out and cause just the scenario you describe here. Good luck with it.

Instruction: Concerning the product "Muck Vac", answer the query provided below.
Question: how to get it working?
Answer:
output_field: It works by the venturi effect - look it up if you are unfamiliar with this. You'll need to connect a standard garden hose between a water faucet and the Muck Vac head. The water faucet must be fully on to work. The water makes a u-turn at the head and flows up the Muck Vac handle creating a suction at the head. This is the venturi effect. The unit is not very effective.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "EarthMinded RBK-0001 DIY Rain Barrel Kit" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: I am missing something. How does the water not keep flowing down the gutter? The picture I saw of the insert looked like the water would just go through the gutter, how is it getting into the barrel? thanks
Output:
output_field: My husband installed it, but from what he explained, that flap inside the gutter reroutes most of the water. It doesn't block the gutter completely during a rain, but generally the flow of water down the gutter is too much to reroute using a device like this. Even if it seems like a flimsy idea, we have had zero problems with our system. We live in north Texas where it doesn't rain a whole lot. Even so, in the first 10 minutes of our first moderate rain after installing this, the 50 gallon barrel filled up. Hope that helps.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Garmin City Navigator Europe NT for Detailed Maps of Eastern and Western Europe (DVD)" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: If I buy the DVD City Navigator Europe, can I then load the maps from my comuter into the Garmin device or do I also need to buy the micro-SD version?
Answer:
output_field: The specific answer is no, you need one or the other but not both. The advantage of buying the pre-loaded micro-SD version is you are all done. Its just plug and play (or so I read). The disadvantage is the pre-loaded mem card version can not be upgraded which is why I bought the DVD. The DVD version can be updated and they even have a life time update/upgrade you can buy which is what I will likely do if I decide to update the euro maps but I am happy with the results so far. That said, it seems just about everyone, including me, has trouble doing the install from the DVD so it is likely that you too will need to call support but they are nice enough and got me through it. It will take you a few hours. You do need to check the FAQ on the Garmin site carefully to assure that your model can have these maps added to it and to confirm that your unit can accept an 8GB card as you will need one that big to get the maps installed. Good luck...

Instruction: Using the details of the product "Stiga Insta Play Table Tennis Table" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: How are the halves held togather while in use?
Response:
output_field: With the system that comes with the table, there are "L" shaped metal brackets at each center corner. The net brackets then slide around the lip of the two brackets, which are about 1/2" apart, and holds the 2 halves together. With the better Stiga net system we use in my club, the net bracket heads clamp at the center point with a head that is about 1.5" wide. When properly tightened down, the table can be moved all over the room with no separation at all. The net set that we use is the Stiga Premium VM model, about $50.00 most places, such as paddlepalace.com.

input_field:
Instruction: Concerning the product "INNOVA 3721 Battery and Charging System Monitor", answer the query provided below.
Question: How accurate is this device (measured against a regular volt meter?
Answer:
output_field: At room temperature and with the yellow or green LED on, it reads 0.01V high according to my (much more accurate than that) meter. In "red" mode (<= 12.05V) it read spot on. I then chilled it by 25C. 16V went from 16.01 to 15.96. A tempco of 2mV/C. So if you've left it in the hot car and let it get to 50C, expect it to read 0.05V high, etc. If you're really stressing about 10 millivolts, remember that just the wiring in the car can easily cause that much difference between the battery and the socket.

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "ANEW CLINICAL Advanced Wrinkle Corrector 50ml / 1.7oz." formulate a response to the following question.
Query: How is this different from Anew Ultimate 7s Day Cream?
Response:
output_field: I used to wonder why I would use Clinical if already using day/night moisturizers. Although Clinical does make your skin feel softer while working on easing those wrinkles, it is not actually a moisturizer. Try 2 weeks with and 2 weeks without Clinical as part of your regimen and you will know the difference. Before my morning makeup (and after washing off the heavier creams of the night) use Clinical and let it 'set' for a few minutes; then I apply my daily moisturizer. When I get home from work (got home-retired now) cleansing my face was/is one of the very first necessities-then my Clinical until bedtime and the creams for then. It is lighter, not greasy at all and really does work. I have one of those deep in between your eyes wrinkle (the kind with which you can inadvertently scare a small child!). It did not go away but made at least a 50-70% decrease in it, and even better in the not so deep wrinkles. Hope this helps!

Input: what is intel GMA HD?
Output:
output_field: It stands for Intel graphics media accelerator or GMA is a series of integrated graphics processors introduced into 2004 by Intel the series targets the market of low-cost graphics solutions the products in the series are integrated onto the motherboard have limited graphics processing power and use a computer's main memory for storage instead of dedicated video memory they are commonly found on netbooks low-price laptops and desktop computers as well as business computers which Do not need high levels of graphics capability

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Raphael Costume, Small" answer the inquiry below.
Input: Can you tell me what the inseams are on the small and the medium? My son is in between sizes right now due to his leg length
Output:
output_field: I got the small for my son (says fits 44 to 48 in height) and he was in 3T clothes, about 36 inches tall & kinda skinny. He definitely needed the legs shortened. I turned it inside out and pinched the material together in the thighs and stitched it real quick to take ~3 inches out, repeated for the calves. After that, it fit great. This was for Halloween 2013. Over the year, he's grown quite a bit and I just let out some of the stitches and he still wears the costume quite a bit. Seems like a lot of work for a Halloween costume but it really wasn't that hard and it was our only choice. He is still crazy about TMNT, probably going to be Leo this year.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Tow Ready 118242 7-Way Replacement Tow Package Wiring Harness" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: Do I still have to run a seperate brake wire from blue to rear or do 7 way brake's work with this
Answer:
output_field: That depends on the vehicle. Most trucks and many suv's are prewired. For the ford trucks the wire is already ran at the factory. This particular wire adapter is made for ford trucks. Use this to add the 7 pin plug or if need to replace a damaged 7 pin and wiring. The plug in for the brake controller for ford trucks prewired under the dash and you can purchase the appropriate pigtail to match. If it hasn't been done already you may need to add the fuses and relays in the fuse panel under the hood in the dedicated spaces so you can get 12v power to trailer and power to brake controller.

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "JinHao 250 Stainless Steel Gold Trim Fountain Pen - Medium" answer the inquiry below.
Input: I have my own ink but I dont know how to use it with this pen. Please tell me how to fill it with ink? Step-by-step please; other FAQs don't help.
Output:
output_field: This pen includes a refillable ink cartridge. All you have to do turn the plunger till it's all the way to the bottom. Then dip the open end into your ink a turn the plunger the opposite direction till the cartridge is full. Then place the cartridge in the pen and turn the plunger till you begin to feed ink into the pen. Turn a little at a time until the ink flows freely as you write, enjoy.

input_field:
Instruction: Concerning the product "Blue Buffalo Wilderness Grain Free Dry Cat Food, Chicken Recipe, 12-Pound Bag", answer the query provided below.
Question: Is this for diabetic cats?
Answer:
output_field: Catinfo.org has some good information on feeding diabetic cats. Diabetic cats should eat foods that are less than 10% carbs. That's hard to find. The owner of that site is a vet and recommends not feeding dry at all, but while transitioning she uses Evo which is around 5% carbs. Maybe 9%. I forget now. That said, my diabetic cat was a dry food junkie. He wouldn't eat at one point so I had to find a dry that wouldn't raise his blood sugar. I ended up using Young Again Pet Foods Zero Carb dry food. It's 0.4% carbs. He had no sugar spikes while eating it. He even went into remission (no insulin) while eating. It's expensive and special order but cost pennies next to the cost of insulin.

You will want to make sure that you get the latest version of this software that Garmin has published, and it will not be easy to tell in advance if that is what the vendor will sell you. If you want to make sure, order it directly from Garmin, or contact the vendor directly before ordering to make sure that they intend to send you the correct version. Since I have been caught before, also make sure that the seller is an authorized vendor of Garmin products. Some companies, e.g., Sony, will not honor a warranty or give you a free upgrade if you did not purchase the product originally from one of their authorized retailers. I am not sure if Garmin has a similar policy, but it might be worth checking before you buy. If I didn't answer your question, try again.

Output:
output_field: No, an outside fixture that exposes the light bulbs to the weather should not have "regular" bulbs... such bulbs are intended to used inside, protected from the weather. You must use an exterior bulb, easy to find in a flood lamp, also in energy efficient flood/spot bulbs. input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "LeapFrog Leapster 2 Learning Game System - Pink" answer the inquiry below.
Input: Rechargeable batteries in leapster 2: Anyone using rechargeable batteries?
Output:
output_field: I use the sanyo eneloop batteries in my son's Leapster--the original, not the Leapster 2. They last as long as regular batteries and the discharge rate is extremely slow when dormant. Regular rechargeables completely discharge within a matter of days when left unused. Plus, the eneloops last up to 1,000 charges, while the charging station is good for something like 300 charges? I purchased my rechargeables for around $15 with a charger included. My son and daughter are each getting a Leapster 2 for Christmas and I have already purchased more eneloops (@ $10 for 4). I don't see why rechargeables wouldn't work in the Leapster 2--I seem to remember reading several reviews where people reported opting for rechargeables vs. charging station. Hope this helps!

input_field:
Instruction: In light of the product "Wheel Rear 700 x 28/35 Silver, QR, Alloy QR Silver FW 5-7Sp, 14g UCP Spokes, 36H" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: what does 700Cx14Gx36H mean? my tires were recently stolen and it used 27 x 1-1/4 tires and 27 1/4 tubes. will this item fit? thanks. i'm a newbie
Output:
output_field: 700mm x 35 is the metric size but that's roughly 27 1/2 x 1 1/4 inches so should fit ok. 14G is 14 gauge spokes and 36H is 36 holes in the rim. I wouldn't worry about these last two items unless you are concerned about weight (not the case usually on a casual use bike). One other thing to be aware of - QR is for quick release axles as opposed to bolt on, and makes wheel removal much easier.

Instruction: In light of the product "Planet Waves Mandolin Strap, Brown" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: How does this fit on the mandolin? I have tried every way I could think of but it won't work. I have a Gibson A4.
Output:
output_field: The string provided in the single-holed side of the leather strap ties around the neck, on the "tuning peg side" of the nut. The leather strip has multiple holes cut for adjustment on the opposite end. Choose the hole closest to the end of the strap and push it on to the strap peg that's down by your tailpeice (which the A4 should have). There you go, change holes or adjust your string to line the mando wherever you find most comfortable.

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Grecian Formula Liquid with Conditioner, 8 fl oz (236 ml) (Pack of 2)" answer the inquiry below.
Input: if this product is not a dye, how does it change hair color?
Output:
output_field: It is NOT a dye. Day by day Grecian Formula gradually replaces gray with your natural looking color. You can stop at anytime and leave a little gray, or keep going. Different hair colors are the result of different amounts of melanin, nature's coloring process, Darker hair simply has more melanin than lighter hair. As melanin production decreases with age hair turns gray. Grecian has the ability to replace lost melanin with a similar-acting pigment You can replace the right amount of lost color by applying Grecian for a few days, up to two/three weeks.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Remington SP-69 MS2 Foil Screen & Cutter Blade Head" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: instructions for sp69 screen and cutter replacement
Output:
output_field: I assume you want to know if there are instructions with the screen and cutter replacement. I don't recall for sure, but I didn't need any. Replacing the cutter (blades) is as easy as pulling the old ones off and pressing the new ones off (they snap into place in a fairly obvious way once you remove the foil screen assembly the way you normally would to clean the blades). Replacing the screen (which is probably the part you need to replace because they are a bit delicate) is more touchy. The screens fit into the entire top (I will call it the screen assembly- the part you remove to clean the razor). I recall that I had to fiddle with it a while to figure it out but I eventually got it without need of any instructions. The replacement screens are great and extend the life of what I find to be a very good razor with one weak part (the foil screens crack and break kind of easily). I hope that helps.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Grundfos 595916 1/25 Horsepower Comfort Series Recirculator Pump", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: You mount the pump at the hot water heater, what type of valve is at the farthest point to allow water circulation? I have slab construction. Thanks
Response:
output_field: Your kit should have come with the bypass valve. This is mounted under any sink between the hot and cold water pipes. Best location is at the farthest point from the hot water tank. I actually have 3 of these bypass valves installed because of the way the hot water is distributed throughout the house. You should have a flex pipe between the cutoff valve and the faucet for both the hot and cold. These flex pipes feed the bypass valve and you will then need two more flex pipes to go from the valve to the faucets. If your kit did not come with the bypass valve and pipes, you can order them online. The valve is referred to as a comfort valve, also from Grundfos. This system works great. I have the timer set to come on about an hour before I get up and run for 3 hours in the morning and 3 hours in the evening.

input_field:
Instruction：Based on the product "Innovation Marbling Kit, Japanese Suminagashi"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：What type paper should I purchase to use the marbling kit?
Output：
output_field: Most marbling instructions recommend unsized paper. Sizing is a starch or gelatin-like coating that is applied to the surface of some papers to make it less absorbent, so the pigment sits on the surface of the paper. Unsized paper is more absorbent, so the pigment is pulled beneath the surface. Many art papers come in both sized and unsized. It can be tedious finding out whether paper is sized/unsized, but there are a lot of people who sell or use paper who can tell you if a paper is sized or unsized. Once you get in that loop, you can find lots of affordable choices, including 'everyday' papers. A google search for sized/unsized works best if you use the name of a specific paper. I've found a lot of information about various art materials by googling my question followed by 'forum' or 'message board' - I've found many good to-the-point discussions that way. Also, watercolor and printmaking books sometimes have detailed sections about absorbency and sizing. You can also remove all or most of sizing from heavier papers, like watercolor paper, by wiping a damp sponge across the surface, then allowing it to dry.

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Samsung UN55F9000 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD 120Hz 3D Smart LED TV (2013 Model)" answer the inquiry below.
Input: With respect to the Samsung 4k Ultra HD sets .....I always thought higher refresh rates were better ie, 240 versus 120. Why only 120 on new samsung?
Output:
output_field: All source rates are 60 or lower. Blu-rays and such are higher with dvd, hd cable, etc being lower. When a set has a higher refresh it has to interpolate or make up info based on an algorithm. This interpolation can make the film/video motion cartoon like. This is also known as refresh dance, when the motion speeds up and slows down. This is very slight and most people cannot see it. In a nutshell it is best not to stray too far from the source refresh. If needed I can go into more detail. I hope this helps.

Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Yamaha Arius YDP162B Traditional Console Digital Piano with Bench, Black Walnut", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: Where do you plug in the cord? Behind the piano or beside it? Is there any space behind the piano to accommodate a plug sticking out from the wall
Response:
output_field: Short answer: Putting the piano in front of an outlet would not be a problem at all. The piano looks best about an inch away from the wall anyways (not as appealing flush-up against it). Long answer: There is about 3/4" between back panel and the wall. If you have a base shoe moulding (at floor-wall juncture), then you would have 1 1/4th" at least. Also, the back panel you see is only a 1/4" thick panel material (and could easily be drilled, cut, etc. without compromising the piano at all), and it reaches 18 1/2" from the ground, leaving about 8" of clear space above that and below the key board console. It is a beautiful looking and playing piano. We have been much more than satisfied with it to say the least. Hope that is helpful.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Curt 13182 Class 3 Trailer Hitch" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: Has anyone installed the 13182 hitch on a 2014 Grand Cherokee EcoDiesel??? What is the effective weight bearing capability after installed?
Output:
output_field: I have installed this hitch on a 2013 grand cherokee larado 3.6 L egine. Quite a simple install. Had to remove the factory installed tow hooks. Curt Mfg. indicates the following: The most common receiver class installed on full-size pickup trucks and SUVs is a Class 3. If your full-size truck is equipped with a tow package, it's probably a Class 3. These receivers have a 2-inch square receiver tube. Class 3 receivers can handle up to 8,000 pound trailers and 800 pounds of tongue weight with a weight carrying ball mount, or up to 12,000 pounds and 1,200 pounds of tongue weight with a weight distributing hitch. This generally exceeds the towing capacities of most non-commercial vehicles, so a Class 3 hitch is rarely the limiting factor when towing. See this link for a full description of towing specs. http://howto.curtmfg.com/Pages/index.cfm.20.html

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Gardner Bender GSW-11 Heavy Duty Toggle Switch, 20A 125VAC, Single Pole Single Throw, ON-OFF, Screw Terminal" answer the inquiry below.
Input: can this be used as a light switch and also how bid is the screw on part
Output:
output_field: I don't know what kind of light you have in mind, but the typical household light switch for lighting circuits is rated at equal, if not less amps, usually 15-20 amps. Unless you are using it for some higher output lamp, it should work fine. Remember, watts divided by volts equals amps. For instance, if you are operating a 75 watt bulb under a 120 volt circuit, you would determine the amps as 75/120 = .625 amps. If you are operating more than one bulb, be sure to add up all of the bulb wattages before you do the math. This switch is rated at 20 amps, so don't go over the rated amperage. The screw portion of the switch is right at 7/16 in. Be careful and good luck.

input_field:
Instruction: In light of the product "Zippo Pipe Lighter Lighter" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: What fluid is better for lighting pipes butane or regular lighter fluid?
Output:
output_field: I prefer the regular lighter fluid for its ease of refill, economy, reliability, and soft flame. If you let the regular lighter 'breathe' for a moment, you won't draw a fuel taste into the pipe. A disposable butane or a match is sometimes easier to use for the initial char if you pack the bowl too tightly, but you are less likely to burn the bowl rim or your fingers with the regular Zippo. My liquid Zippo is 50 years old and lights every time. I've had expensive butane lighters that became frustratingly unreliable in less than a year.

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "Duracell GoEasy Charger / Rechargable / includes 2 AA rechargeable batteries," formulate a response to the following question.
Query: I meant mA, What charging current is used? I prefer 200 for AA batteries.
Response:
output_field: As per the packageing information, the 2-1,700 mAh batteries (AA) included should take 6 hours to fully charge. The charger works according to the capacity of the batteries being charged. For instance, I also purchased some 2000 mAh and also some 2,450 mAh batteries (all Duracell) to use in various products. Certain BlueTooth and other wireless items require a higher storage of energy capacity to work efficiently. If you go online and look for Duracell batteries you will come across a chart showing the color-coded tips of each capacity. Newer uncharged batteries, such as those that come with the charger, may take a bit longer to charge. But the charger itself tells you when things are done, by displaying a GREEN LED. If the LED is RED, the batteries are still charging. If the RED LED Flashes, you have an "abnormal" battery and it will have to be replaced. Anything bad out of the package is fully replaceable by Duracell, if not by your local retailer. I've trusted Duracell and their products for decades. Very reliable. The only thing even CLOSE is the Eveready LITHIUM/ION non-rechargables... and they cost as much as the Duracell Re-Chargeables!

To kill fleas, ticks and lice, thoroughly mix 1/2 oz (1 tablespoon) of dip with 1 gallon of warm water. For outdoor animals in areas of severe infestations, 2 oz (4 tablespoons) per gallon may be used. Make fresh solution daily. If animal's coat is very dirty, bathe first with an Adams shampoo. Instruction：Based on the product "UMX Habu 180 DF BNF Basic with AS3X Technology"，please give the answer for corresponding question.

output_field: This little Habu is not the same as flying a helicopter. And it can reach a speed close to 50 mph! Your acquired skills in flying a helicopter will certainly be helpful, though. input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "Shure SM93 Lavalier Microphone", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: Can I use the Shure SM93 on another body pack that is not manufactured by Shure? I have a body pack from another manufacture.
Output:
output_field: call Shure tech support. They are very qualified. If you have only the mic iteself, which is not the item you've asked about, I think you'll learn that the mic needs 5 VDC bias current, which the preamp provides, if you have the preamp model, which this item is. The preamp terminates in a male XLR, which itself requires phantom power. You can purchase the mic itself, without the preamp, which is designed to be used with Shure body packs. You may also find that Shure makes lav mics which work with other manufacturers, avaiable on the usual mail order supply companies, which I can't name here. You probably know which ones to which I refer.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Vetri-Science Laboratories Bladder Strength Tablet for Dogs - 90 Chewable Tablets" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: Are these 50mg? That is what my vet recommended!
Output:
output_field: Catherine w. your vet is recommending Proin. This is a multivitamin targeted for dogs, both male and female, for bladder control, urinary incontinence, and prevention of urinary tract infections. It's a more natural and safer alternative to medication such as Proin. Proin is known to cause serious health issues in dogs including death. This product in my experience also works much better than Proin. It's also cheaper, and if you miss a dose nothing bad happens. If you miss a single dose of Proin your dog will be peeing everywhere in 3 hours.

Instruction: Concerning the product "Presto A10 Printing Mailbox for Presto Service", answer the query provided below.
Question: "Secret" button push for initiating an email retrieval call? Can anyone tell me what that combination is?
Answer:
output_field: The "secret" code for initiating email retrieval is as follows: 1) press and continue to hold down the "Stop" button 2) while continuing to hold it down, press and release the Volume Up (+) button twice You should then here a tone (if the volume is turned up) which signifies the Printing Mailbox will now go retrieve its mail. In my experience, I find it typically takes five minutes to make the call, process the data and print out the mail (unless there are many pages, then it takes a little longer). Hope this helps, Peter Radsliff Presto CEO

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "Jaybird Freedom Sprint Bluetooth Headphones - Retail Packaging - Midnight Black", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: How easy is to use the control buttons in these headphones (answering calls, raising volume, moving to the next song, etc)?
Output:
output_field: Very easy to use, there are three buttons the power and the up and down volume buttons. The power button lets you answer calls or hang up from them. The buttons are on the ear piece itself which can make it hard to operate while running. They have a model with the controls away from the earpiece on the cord. If advancing your songs adjusting volume or answering calls while on the go is the goal then I'd go with the bluebuds X model. I have both I use the freedom sprints for walking around and the bluebuds X for running. You can just press the buttons to change volume or answer calls but you have to hold the button down to advance songs and the buttons on the jay birds are small so it can be a pain to try to operate while running you'll end using your MP3 player to advance your music. So it depends on what you'll be doing while you wear them.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Nutiva Organic Chia Seeds, 12-Ounce Bag" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: organic versus non-organic chia seeds
Output:
output_field: Hi Michael. I use to buy and eat organic as much as I can and this is why I ordered those Chia seeds. Hard to say if they are better or not than the non-organic because nutrients are similar but when it comes to seeds, I am always concerned about pesticides or other chemical treatments. So even though I was not impressed by the packaging (the bag doesn't seal very well once open) so far I am OK with this brand. Recommendation = soak 1 or 2 seeds spoons at the time and put it in a small container to soak in your fridge. You will get a kind of jelly that is very convenient to add to a shake for example. I never eat the seeds directly : way too small to be crushed by your teeth....A bag lasts very long because you don't want to take too much every day (laxative effect....). Hope that this will help you make a decision on your buying.

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "Razer Kraken PRO Over Ear PC and Music Headset - Green" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: i gave this to my son for Xmas and one of the sides just stopped working! There are no tears, cuts, etc. in the wires! How do I fix?
Response:
output_field: It sounds like you will have to go through Razer's warranty. I think they have a 1 year warranty. I would just go through Razer's official website. Unless you get some heavy duty headphones, most will break if not taken care of properly. I hang mine on a hook when I'm not using mine. Or, it could be a wiring issue when the headphones themselves aren't messed up, but maybe the wires did get messed up. To prevent this issue, I keep my wires twisty-tied together so they don't touch the floor. I've gone through extensive research on how to protect headphones because I've had a few that I've gone through and finally found that if you take good care in protecting them & making sure they're taken care of, you can prevent these damaging issues. But yes, try to redeem their warranty through their official Razer website.

Instruction: With reference to the product "Garmin MapSource TOPO! US 24k West Topographic Coverage for Washington, Oregon, California, and Nevada (DVD)" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: How do I download the DVD to the hand held GPS? I have the disc uploaded to my computer
Answer:
output_field: Yes, like Richard says, plug gps into pc. Download and install "Base Camp" on your pc. Then you can either click the Icon at the top Base Camp tool bar to "send to device", or click on "device" and then "send to device". Some of the maps (City Navigator) have to be unlocked on line. Be careful, gps's will only hold a limited amount of maps. The Garmin Montana 650T will only display maps if there are less than 3,000 downloaded on it. 24K Region Topo maps have thousands of maps on them so you should only select areas you think you will need and download those maps. Too many and the gps will not work. All else fails, call Garmin support. They are pretty helpful.

input_field:
Instruction: Concerning the product "UTG 3-9x32 Compact CQB Bug Buster AO RGB Scope with Med. Picatinny Rings, 2" Sunshade", answer the query provided below.
Question: There have been complaints of a misaligned reticle, has anyone experienced or heard of this?
Answer:
output_field: Mine is slightly off, perhaps 2-3 degrees. some have complained about that will cause elevation or windage adjustments to change too. Yes, that is correct to a point. Let's stay that worse case scenario, the turrets and reticle were canted 45 degrees off from each other. That would mean any elevation or windage would equally effect both. But for every 1 degree, that would only result in 1/45 of a change in the other. that equates to .02" for every inch of elevation/windage. So if the scope has 1/2" per click adjustment at 100 yards, One click of windage/elevation would result in (unwanted) .01" in elevation/windage movement with a reticle that was canted 1 degree off. Even at 5 degrees, that is still only .05" (1.2mm) at 100 yards. The point is if that small of an offset really matters to anyone, they should not be buying a $90 scope in the first place.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Frigidaire Gas Oven Ignitor 5303935066" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: what does this part do.my gas oven wont heat up on bake.will this part fix the problem?
Output:
output_field: On ovens that use electric ignitors (instead of a pilot light), these ignitor heat up and glow bright yellow and ignite the gas. They are almost so bright you can't look at them. Look for yours underneath the oven where the gas is, turn it on and if yours is orange or dim it needs to be replaced. When the ignitor is on, the gas flows based on the amount of electrical resistance, if yours is failing, the current isn't strong enough so the gas doesn't open fully. This can cause no ignition or extremely slow preheat.

input_field:
Instruction：Based on the product "AT&T 3G Microcell Wireless Cell Signal Booster Tower Antenna (4G Compatible)"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：Someone at the local Amvets has one of these, and asked if I could set it up. Is it just a plug and play unit? No contract or anything? Thanks :)
Output：
output_field: There is no contract. It will come with instructions on how to set it up. You set it up in by going to an ATT website and then following the instructions. You need to plug it in to the wall and then connect it to your dsl modem or other internet device. So, of course, you need to have internet connectivity at your residence or wherever you are setting this up. The ATT microcell then connects to the internet via this set-up procedure. Once it has done that, it will function in your house as a mini cell tower. It's not a signal booster, it functions exactly like a cell tower in your house. That's it. There's no contract or per-month cost. You just buy the unit.

input_field:
Instruction：Based on the product "Powerfit PF31026D 4000 psi Commercial Grade Telescoping Spray Wand for Pressure Washers, 18-Feet"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：This is not a 3/8" inlet. It is 9/16". Where can I find the adapter to fit my power washer?
Output：
output_field: This is actually a 3/8" quick-connect. Consumer-grade pressure washers (such like you'd find at HD or Lowe's) are sized as a 1/4" quick-connect (like the spray-tip of this unit is). If you've got a similar setup (most consumer-grade units are similar), you'll want to get a male M22 to 3/8 quick-connect to hook up to your pressure washer hose so that you can use this wand. You may need to get a couple different adapters - Amazon has the Forney 75117 (Male M22 to 3/8" Male NPT) and the Forney 75129 (Female 3/8 NPT to Female 3/8 Quick-Connect) which should do the job.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Dean Vendetta XM Electric Guitar - Natural" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: Is this guitar worth using for a black metal/sludge/noise project?
Answer:
output_field: Purely on its own, without inflection from any processing FX? Probably not. But no guitar is, really - is it? This guitar can handle being heavily processed though, so if you have outboard FX, or FX running on a computer, this guitar will give you the s/n ratio you need. I've used this through an old Roland GP8 multiFX processor, a Floor Pod and Native Instruments Guitar Rig and it holds up pretty well. If you're after speed picking, I'd say go with something more refined - this guitar is a great workhorse, but it is crudely constructed. I lucked out with the one I bought, but I've talked to people who've ordered the same guitar and gotten a dog - malformed fretwork being a particular complaint, and just the thing to kill speed picking.

input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "Infantino Squeeze Pouches, 50-Count" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: What kind of foods have you put in the pouches that can be easily sucked out? Sweet potato was too thick for my LO to suck out.
Answer:
output_field: Don't put sweet potato by itself...mix it down with apple or pear. I usually use apple or pear sauce as a base to whatever else I mix with it. Apple, sweet potato & carrot with a small amount of maple syrup has been a favorite. When I make apple sauce I tend to have an overabundance of granny smith apples so I add a little maple syrup to offset the tart flavor of the apple. Look up online any of the well known name brand pouches and see what kind of mixes they are putting together. That is where I got a lot of ideas. For instance, pear, blueberry & beet. I am mixing the nutritive veggies/fruits a lot heavier than you see in the commercial pouches, but again if you use apple or pear sauce as a base it will be naturally sweeter and a little thinner than most things you would put in by themselves.

If 4 people switch theirs to A and are within range of each other, then those 4 people should be able to communicate. And the same with channel B. Evidently the channels can't support more than 4 at the same time. This is my interpretation of the information on the back of the box.

input_field:
Instruction: Concerning the product "Whirlpool 902894 Door Gasket", answer the query provided below.
Question: how do I replace Whirlpool 902894 Door Gasket?
Answer:
output_field: Pull the old gasket out of the groove. Clean the groove out with soapy water. Insert the new gasket with flared side toward the groove (the flare-out helps the gasket stay in the groove). Start gasket at one end, putting pressure on the gasket with your fingers to seat the gasket around the opening. Once you have seated the gasket, go back around the entire gasket, pushing on it with your fingers to make sure it is properly seated. Close the dishwasher door and this will further seat the gasket evenly. Test the dishwasher to ensure no leakage.

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "Sony ICF-SW23 FM / MW / SW1-7 Portable World Band Receiver Radio (Japan Import)", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: I would like to know that if this radio works in pakistan for fm
Output:
output_field: Yes, it does work in Pakistan. But VERY difficult to tune (they squeeze the combined Japanese and international FM bands into one band within a few centimeters of the display). I would also look at others. For FM the Kaito KA321 is around $20.- and (my opinion) at least as good on FM. More "upscale": Look at Tecsun's line of DSP radios. Amazon cost ~ $50.-, they have many useful features which (the older design) SONY does not have. E.g. electronic pre-selection and memory storage of useable stations, the display can be lit, choice of alarms, programmable SLEEP function (battery does not unintentionally drain when you fall asleep at night), built-in charger, for trips to Europe "LW" (which contrary to the Amazon description the SONY does not have). Examples for 'more upscale': Tecsun PL-380 or, my preference, the PL-310et.

Instruction: With reference to the product "Wondfo One Step Ovulation (LH) Test Strips, 50-Count" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: Should you see a pattern throughout the month?Should your lines gradually getting darker or are they random until you are ovulating (a dark line)?
Answer:
output_field: Some see theirs gradually getting darker. Mine do. Within about three days prior to the LH surge I do see a light line on the positive. Remember though, any color or shade not matching the control line is a negative. This is important information for women going through IUI procedures. For everyone doing the baby dance the natural way, the gradual darkening line might help. If you see a light positive you should baby dance every other day until you get a true positive. You need to baby dance within 24 hours of seeing that dark, true positive strip. Once the LH surge is detected your egg will be released in about 24 hours time. Some like to be sure sperm is there waiting for the egg when it travels through the fallopian tube. Good luck

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Euro Cuisine YM80 Yogurt Maker" answer the inquiry below.
Input: would it be possible to use a glass bowl inside the unit if I wanted to make one batch of the same flavor and not have to use the little jars?
Output:
output_field: Yes, you absolutely can use a single glass bowl. This is what i use and it's available on Amazon: Pyrex Storage 7-Cup Round Dish with Dark Blue Plastic Cover, Clear. It fits this machine perfectly. I make one liter / quart batches of yogurt in this bowl (uncovered) and then strain it using #4 cone coffee filters in coffee filter holders. With two #4 filter cones you can strain all of that batch at one time. Spoon the still-warm yogurt into the cone filters and let the the whey strain into whatever appropriate container you have (in the fridge) for about an hour or so. The yield is about 400 ml of thick Greek yogurt and 600 ml of clear whey. While protein powder is often made from whey, whole fresh whey is actually lactose dense and protein poor. All of the nutrients I am interested in are in the yogurt. What you do with the whey is up to you. I pour mine down the drain.

Instruction: Concerning the product "Alpine KTP-445U 4-channel Power Pack Amplifier", answer the query provided below.
Question: Have 01 camry & running jvc deck to jbl 6x9 and 6 1/2. can this amp be connected with universal connectors or do you have to solder the wires to deck?
Answer:
output_field: You can use the universal connectors to connect the wires (it is faster than soldering them). However I personally like to solder them and use shrink tubs to protect soldered joints. I also like to do as much of the wire connections on my work bench using alligator clips to hold wires when soldering them (always tin the wires prior to solder in them together). Where ever possible do soldering without any receiver or amp connected. Its always better to solder wires to insure a good wire connections. Either way take your time to insure good connections. Hope this helps Good luck Dave Dave

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Tetra 25931 TetraFauna Viquarium, fits 20- to 55-Gallon Tanks" answer the inquiry below.
Input: How does the water get through to the waterfall and how is the water clarity after two weeks?
Output:
output_field: There is a sub-pump inside, and it pulls the water through the rocks. The sub-pump is very small though, and should not be your only source of filtration. (...especially a smaller tank with several fish or a turtle..) This system is more or less a biological filtration system. ..ie... good bactetia growing on the rocks, to convert harmful amonia. In addition, it's not very tall at all, and your water level will be low. I set mine up in a 55 gallon, and my water level was only half-full. It's just not a very practicle system, and your better off with a canister system, either outside or an in-your tank system. Even a large waterfall filter would be better. Hope this helps.

Instruction: Using the details of the product "TASCAM US-1800 16-in, 4-out USB 2.0 Audio Interface" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: Do I have to use the Digital in and OUT into my computer to get all 8 tracks simultaneously recorded and separated in Cubase. Or with the USB out?
Response:
output_field: The USB is the only way to connect the interface to a computer. The digital out is a reflection of the main output, and is used to send audio to monitors or a recorder, ETC... (in other words, the digital out is not for connectivity with a computer, unless, it is a separate computer that is not running the interface) Keep in mind, you need to have USB connectivity before the digital out (or any out) will work.

input_field:
Instruction：Based on the product "Ballistic HA0778-M355 Ballistic Hard Case with Holster for iPhone 4/4S - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Black/Red"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：How do I remove the case from my iPhone?
Output：
output_field: Thats is a great question. These things were built to stay on. I did figure it out though. You don't want to do it often because of the risk of damage to the case. The 'factory way' , which is difficult at best is: at the bottom right of the case is a notch big enough to fit a screwdriver or something flat into to pry the case open. I haven't had much luck with that. My way is pretty easy but DO IT AT YOUR OWN RISK! it could damage the case. Place your thumb on the bottom of the faceplate, near the charge hole. If u press up with your thumb it will flex upword. Do this on the bottom right corner of the charger opening. It will lift enough that you can slip a credit card or screwdriver under the corner and pry up. Or, if you're lucky, the pressure of your thumb may pop the corner open, then u can remove it. Hope that helps.

Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Fisher-Price Go Baby Go! Bounce & Spin Zebra" answer the inquiry below.
Input: older toddlers? I have a 17 mth old. she loves to dance and bounce...would this toy be to "young" for her?
Output:
output_field: Hi, I just bought this for my 18 month old and I was worried about him outgrowing it too soon also and it being too young, but he adores it... but the surprise was...so does his SIX year old brother LOL. Ok, it's not going to hold the six year old's attention for very long, but he got on it and bounced around. The weight of the child pushes the zebra down and allows it to spin (if she were standing next to it w/o pushing down, it would not move round) so by sitting on it my 6 year old spun himself in one full circle just to 'see if he could'. They say the age goes up to about 36 months and the weight capacity is 43 lbs (my 6 year old is 41 lbs, just went to the annual checkup) It has been fun for the little one and is something nice and active for him to do now that the weather has turned cold and we can't go outside. I've spent more money on things we've used for a shorter amount of time and I really like this product :)

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Polk Audio RTI A3 Bookshelf Speakers (Pair, Black)", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: How do these compare to the RTI A1's? Noticeably larger/better sound or just slightly? Thank you :)
Response:
output_field: Nick- I listened to the RTI A1's in a local store and I liked the sound because the bass was pretty tight and the mids were clean. They had a nice, sweet sound overall. I used to own the RTI A3's but sold them because, to me, the sound was tiring to my ears. The highs are slightly "shrill". And my efforts to resolve the issue did not work. The RTI A3's look really cool and they are very well built. But, I couldn't get used to the shrill tweeters, even after playing with my tone controls. After a while, I didn't want to listen to them. So I went back and hooked up my Bostons. The RTI A3's seem to get a lot of good reviews. But I will never buy them again. My friendly advice is to try a different speaker. I wish I could suggest some others. But ultimately, you should listen to several models/brands and make your own decision.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Marineland Emperor Power Filter", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: Is there anything else that can cause a clean emperor 280 to make a rattling sound and not pull the water into the filter replaced the impeller
Response:
output_field: Hi Barbara, The only place these things will rattle is in the impeller assembly, it sounds like the impeller is not correctly seated in the housing and not making correct magnetic contact with the motor, as a result your impeller isn't turning enough rpms and not drawing water up through your intake. If the water level in your filter has dropped too far you may have lost your prime. Before taking the impeller apart, make sure you manually fill your filter with water, then turn it on and see if it draws water. If it doesn't, don't hesitate to take it to your local pet store and ask them to check the impeller assembly remember, they don't want to lose your business. Good luck.

Instruction: With reference to the product "Oneida Flight 45-Piece Stainless-Steel Flatware Set, Service for 8" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: What is the difference between 18/0 and 18/8
Answer:
output_field: 18 refers to 18% chromium content, and the other number refers to the percentage of nickel content. There is no difference between 18/8 and 18/10. It's purely marketing. 18/0 however, has no nickel content, which means it won't keep its silver-like shine over the years.

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "Shure SLX24/SM58 Handheld Wireless System, J3" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: how do I know if this mic is usable for the DC area UHF Multi-Frequency on the Shure slx24/sm58 handheld wireless system, H5
Response:
output_field: You need to consult a spectrum database for your area. According to http://whitespaces.spectrumbridge.com/whitespaces/home.aspx and http://www.google.org/spectrum/whitespace/channel/ your area would best be served by a device that operates on TV channel 32 or 39. Channel 32 covers 578-584 MHz. If you consult the Shure documentation, The SLX devices using the J3 band would best suit your needs, as they operate at 572-596 MHz. The SLX series doesn't have a band that operates on channel 39. This device, since it is on the H5 band, would be usable on only part of its range.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Victor 22-5-00106-8 Heavy Duty Tubeless Tire Repair Kit", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: How big of a hole will this plug?
Response:
output_field: I can't give you an exact number, but usual road punctures, like small nails and screws will be fine. The bore tool is 3/16 inch in diameter. So anything 3/16" and smaller will absolutely be fine. I'm going to guess that the larger the hole, the more temporary the seal. I will say that there isn't enough plug material to fill a 1/2" hole. 1/4" will probably fill, maybe even 5/16". Anything bigger and I doubt the plug will actually be able to fill the hole. Now let me add to this. There is a difference between an actual 1/2" hole vs a 1/2" nail that's punctured the tire. A 1/2" inch nail won't create a 1/2" hole because the rubber will expand to accommodate the nail. The actual hole may be much smaller. So it appears that a 1/2" screw will create a hole smaller than 3/16".

input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "DoMatcha DoMatcha Organic 2nd Harvest Matcha, 2.82-Ounce" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: How is the taste in comparison to the 1st Harvest? Is this matcha bitter or astringent when made the traditional way (hot water + matcha)?
Answer:
output_field: I got this from their website. "The DōMatcha Ceremonial grade of matcha is handpicked in the spring at the first flush, only the brand new top leaves are chosen. These leaves render a very smooth but strong flavor, considered to be one of the top grades of matcha. As a result it commands a higher value in the marketplace. The 2nd Harvest DōMatcha is handpicked in August, the leaves for 2nd Harvest have been on the tea plant longer and render a more astringent flavor. As a result it has a lower value. You can see this by the pricing. The 2nd Harvest gives you more than twice as many servings for only $6-8 more than the Ceremonial matcha. If you are a purist or traditionalist and enjoy your matcha with just hot water, then the Ceremonial will give you the better tasting matcha. If you are going to use your matcha in a latte or a blender drink, then you may as well go for value and use the 2nd Harvest. I personally use the Ceremonial grades (organic and non) as they seem to give me more energy and mental clarity."

Instruction: Referencing the product "Boba Wrap - Grey", generate an answer to the specified question.

Output:
output_field: This is similar to a Moby in that it's a stretchy, knit fabric; IMO, the Boba's fabric is significantly thicker and more substantial than the Moby. User instructions say it can be used for older toddlers, but from experience, stretchy type carriers don't feel as supportive once they get that big. I used this carrier mostly when my baby was very young. I'd recommend a structured carrier (Ergo, Boba 3G, Beco Soleil, Kinderpack, etc.) or a woven wrap -- besides offering more support for the weight, you can wear on your back which is much more comfortable as the child gets heavier. Hope to help!

input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "Leviton TBI03-1LW Tabletop Slide Control Lamp Dimmer 300-Watt White" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: Does this dimmer work with LED bulbs?
Answer:
output_field: Yes, this dimmer, and in fact all dimmers, will work with dimmable LED lights. It just won't work well. There are a number of drawbacks to using a standard dimmer with LED lights, including the light not getting as dim as it could and not lighting-up if the dimmer is set too low. I don't *think* it has any effect on the lifetime of the led bulb. If you want to control dimmable LED lights (and dimmable CFLs) then you need a HID dimmer to rectify the shortcomings of a standard dimmer. I personally have only standard dimmers in my now totally LED lit home, but I will slowly be swapping out the old dimmers for new HIDs.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Uncle Mike's Quick Detachable Remington 870 Express 12-Gauge Internal Ratchet Cap Set Sling Swivels (Blued, 1-Inch Loop)" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: What is the difference with 'internal' and 'external' rachet? And can this be attached to my 870 express tactical?
Answer:
output_field: Yea, that can be confusing since they changed the terminology a bit. I believe the external ratchet used to be called the ball and detent lug system. Unscrew and remove the magazine cap and look for a small ball bearing on the barrel ring and for detents around the outer ring of the cap that match the ball. That would be the external type. If you have no ball bearing on the barrel ring, and the type with indentations and protrusions (teeth) on the magazine insert that match the internal component of the magazine cap, you have the internal ratchet.

Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Royal Dark 100% Pure Yacon Syrup - 8 fl oz | Ultra Premium Natural Yacon Syrup - Healthy & Delicious Tasting Sugar Alternative with Natural Prebiotic FOS Fiber | Low Calorie Low-Glycemic with No Additives or Preservatives" answer the inquiry below.
Input: Why does that last inch of product become so thick it is no longer useable?
Output:
output_field: With any of the brands of authentic Yacon syrup that I have tried, I find it is necessary to shake it vigorously before every use. I also flip it upside down after every other use to keep the solids thoroughly mixed. If you don't do that from day one, what you describe happens. When that has happened to me, I put a little hot water into the bottle and shake it until it is the consistency that allows it to pour. Most brands do not say "refrigerate after opening" though I think this brand may say that. I do not refrigerate mine because it does make it much harder to shake and remove from the bottle.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Fujitsu ScanSnap S1500 Instant PDF Sheet-Fed Scanner for PC" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: ADF 50 page maximum: Once you have reached the 50 page maximum, do you have to close your scanning session, or can you continue entering more pages as a single session?
Answer:
output_field: Yes. Each scan profile has a checkbox labelled "Continue scanning after current scan is finished." If this box is checked, the software pauses when the ADF becomes empty, allowing you to insert more pages and continue scanning into the same file. This is repeated until you run out of pages and hit the "stop scanning" button. If the box is unchecked, then scanning ends when the ADF is empty and the file is closed. However, with the included "ScanSnap Organizer" software, you can open a PDF and then easily "append" several more PDFs -- so it is easy to combine multiple files into one.

input_field:
Instruction: Concerning the product "Essick Air 1041 Replacement Console Wick", answer the query provided below.
Question: Should this filter be replaced every year? If not, how do you clean it?
Answer:
output_field: Hi Marlene, First I should point out this product is not really a filter. It's a wick that absorbs and holds moisture so the blower fan can push air through it and drive the water into the surrounding environment. How often it needs replacing depends upon how often the humidifier cycles and on the mineral content of your water. If you run your humidifier a lot and you are not using filtered water, then these wicks typically need replacing about every three months (at least). I use filtered water in my humidifier to reduce the mineral content but I still have to replace the wick every 5-6 months. It's pretty simple to determine when your wick is clogged with minerals because the humidifier will basically run non-stop as there will be no moisture in the wick therefore no moisture going into the air. These wicks are not really cleanable because they are too fragile. Once they get clogged with minerals (i.e. "lime") they need to be disposed of and replaced.

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Astro Pneumatic PR14 Air Riveter" answer the inquiry below.
Input: what air pressure do you need to run this gun.
Output:
output_field: Hello, The manufacturer states a range of air Pressure at 90-120psi to operate. I always run at 120 psi to make sure it gets a nice hard pull on the rivet. I tried backing off to 90 psi a few times but it did not seat them down as tight as full pressure does. This was with steel rivets, so aluminum rivets may pull okay at the lower pressure. Thats something you would have to test out on an few scraps. For the best overall result make sure you push the gun nose and the rivet flange up tight and level to the work piece right as you pull the trigger. If you let the nose slack back while you trigger it the rivet will not pull up tight to the work piece. And if you dont have it flat and flush it will set the rivet cocked at an angle and you will have to pull it out and start over. Good luck.

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "Two Little Fishies ATL5445W Ball Valve for Regulating Water Flow, 1/2-Inch", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: I plan to use the valves for flow control to my canister filter, do I put the valve at the IN-TAKE side, or RETURN side of Canister filter?
Output:
output_field: Return side, you want the pump to be throttled back from the effluent (outgoing) side of the pump. If you out it on the influent(incoming) side of the pump you could create a situation where the pump is running and not enough water to getting to it. Pumps need to have as much water available to them as possible. Not only do I run small pumps in aquaculture systems, but I am maintenance manager for a rural water district maintaining their pumps as well.

output_field: It CAN be. This depends on a) how temperamental your skin is and b) where (what area of your body) you are going to use it on. You won't have much use of it, let's say, on your legs or underarms. On the face, you should first test it - there is nothing in here that should provoke an irritation, BUT, some people's skin is sensitive after shaving. So try it on your cheek or chin first, and try it before, and after, shaving. One might work better for you than the other. I find that it also firms and tightens my face a bit, and smoothies out any bumps on my upper arms and chest.

input_field:
Instruction: Concerning the product "No Stress Chess", answer the query provided below.
Question: Can this game be played by one person? If so, will there still be an element of surprise?
Answer:
output_field: I guess it could. The way the "no stress" part works.... each player picks a card that tell you what piece you can move and the directions that piece can move. So you might really want to move your Knight but you get a card that says move your Pawn. In theory you could play both sides. The interesting part is that as you pick these cards, you might have to leave your King unprotected and you start thinking - I would never make this move.... I would move here instead. There really isn't game strategy when you play with cards - you are playing more "move by move" strategy - trying to do the least amount of damage. Its fun and definitely helps teach the game in a stress free way. Not sure if I answered your question.

Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Creative Options Thread Organizer" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: Is the organizer made from "soft" plastic or hard plastic?
Output:
output_field: PenBeads, if your definition of "hard" plastic is absolute rigidity; it is not. If your definition of "soft" plastic is flimsy and very pliable; it is not. The main structure (outside walls and inner divider cells) is of plastic approximately 1/16th of an inch thick - it does move should you apply pressure. A loose comparable is the plastic of good Tupperware; but not flimsier like ZipLock storage containers. The two lids are somewhat thinner but adequate. However, an observation on the lid is that the closure construction is a flap along the side of the lid that snaps onto the main structure. This might, just might, fatigue over time and split along the seam. Too bad there is no way to contact you directly; mine is too big for my needs - I'd just send mine to you.

Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Keysands Live Organic Water Kefir Grains (Crystals, Tibicos)" answer the inquiry below.
Input: do i have to use brown sugar as i have candita?
Output:
output_field: I have only ever used organic cane sugar, supplemented occasional with a teaspoon of unsulfured blackstrap molasses. I know you can use other sugars like coconut sugar, etc, though I've never tried. I've never tried with sugar alternatives, artificial or natural sweeteners like stevia, so I couldn't give you any advice there. Honey will eventually diminish the health of your cultures, due to it's natural antimicrobial/bacterial properties. One thing I will say, when brewing the kefir, the cultures will process the sugar that is in your mix: so even if you're adding a third cup of sugar to the grains, after 48 hours there will be less sugar in the brew. When you bottle it after the 48 hour brew cycle, then you can add whatever you want. It'd be worth experimenting with! good luck!

input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "M Essentials MiraZyme Odor Eliminator, 8-Ounce" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: Is this safe to use to soak or spray an "oilskin" coat?
Answer:
output_field: Depends on what you are calling "oilskin". The originals were cotton canvas coated with linseed oil. I doubt that the Mirazyme would be a threat to these, but I'm not sure. The Brits and Aussies both make wax coated cotton waterproof garments. Again, I doubt that Mirazyme would be a problem but I haven't tried it on these. Neither of these fabrics are in common usage any more. The modern usage for "oilskins" is foul weather gear, as used by fishermen and boaters. These are synthetic fabrics coated with a soft plastic, typically PVC. These are definitely safe with Mirazyme. In fact, they are a prime target for it. This kind of clothing can live a wretched life, soiled with fish slime and lubricants, and taken off wet and thrown in a corner to stew for days or weeks. Powerful producers of odor. These can, once thoroughly cleaned in a front loading washer, can be treated with a Mirazyme soak and hang dried successfully. They shouldn't be run through a dryer. The heat can damage the plastic coating.

input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "Mega Motion 3-Wheel Travel Pal Scooter, Blue" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: Top speed and range limit?
Answer:
output_field: I found a site [WalMart where it is out-of-stock] that lists the top speed as 4.25mph and range as 10 miles. Top speed will depend on your weight my wife used one and weight was around 270lbs and it went pretty fast. Weight limit is supposed to be 250lbs; my personal guess is 300lbs could still use it. I weigh around 235lbs so my top speed was higher and I turned it down to a slower speed. As to range, I took it to Walt Disney World and had no problems with the battery but I only spent 12 to 14 hours running around. A quick overnite recharge puts you back up and running. I did not use the chair as my main means of transport as I can still drive a car. Sorry but the truth is it depends mainly on how much you weigh and up and down hills. Since it weighs around 84lbs with the seat on it, it tends to not like steep hills but is easy to get up over threasholds unlike much heavier chairs.

output_field: It depends on how thin and short your hair is. If your hair is very thin and no longer than your shoulders, I think this would be thick/long enough to over the purple tips. When you say "put in a bun," do you mean put your real hair in a bun, then cover with the hair piece, or cover with the hairpiece then form the whole thing into a bun? If you're referring to the first option, I don't believe the tie/clip is large enough to go around a bun since it was designed to wrap around a pony tail. You may be able to form the entire pony into a bun, but I didn't have very good luck doing so. I hope this helps! Good luck!

input_field:
Instruction：Based on the product "LeapFrog Jake and The Never Land Pirates Learning Game (Works with LeapPad Tablets, LeapsterGS, and Leapster Explorer)"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：Anyone know what the micro modulus are the game keeps talking about and how to down load them? My son keeps asking me about it. Are they free?
Output：
output_field: A Micro Mod is a small modification to a Didj game. To obtain a Micro Mod, open the LeapFrog Connect application on your computer and select the Micro Mod icon on the Didj home page. Using the Bitz (or points) you have earned playing your Didj games on the handheld, you can purchase Micro Mods for selected Didj games. Micro Mods range from alternate background music on a game to adding a special power to one of the game's characters. Once you "purchase" the Micro Mod with your Bitz, the Micro Mod will be synced to your Didj handheld the next time you sync your Didj to your computer.

input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "InSinkErator Badger 5, 1/2 HP Food Waste Disposer" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: I have a badger 5 it is leaking water at bottom near reset bottom plus does a new one came with a ss ring for inside the sink
Answer:
output_field: If your garbage disposal is leaking out the bottom near the reset button, you most likely have a leak in the metal plate that is located directly under the blades. This plate is designed to protect the electrically powered parts of the motor (the rotor, the shaft, etc.) from moisture, but it is rather thin and is only made of galvanized steel. After a year or two, especially if you use highly acidic cleaners which you rinse down your sink, the zinc layer will corrode and expose the steel, which will then also start to corrode, until something hard eventually pokes some kind of hole through the plate somewhere (could be somewhere very small), signaling the end of the machine's service life. The plate is not meant to be repaired, only replaced along with the rest of the unit. That water is getting through to your rotor is an electrical hazard, and should be dealt with immediately (by removing the damaged unit). The manufacturer has figured out that the blades need to me made of stainless steel, but has chosen to skimp on making other interior parts of this more-expensive metal. Good luck!

Instruction: Based on the product "5 Gallon Bubble Magic Extracting Washing Machine" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: Does this unit have a spin cycle if using as a washer? Or do you have to buy a separate spin dryer to remove the water from your clothes?
Answer:
output_field: No, this washer does not have a spin dry function. Also, as a clothing washer I would highly recommend the Panda or Basecamp washers over this model. None of them have spin dry, so you will need a separate spinner. The small blue spinner works well. It operates at 1,600 RPM. This is quite a bit faster than a typical washing machines spin cycle. Those are normally about 600 RPM. The larger stainless steel drum spinner operates at 3,200 RPM and leaves your clothes dry enough to wear in a pinch. They will hang dry in only about an hour out of the faster machine. Buy whichever one suits your needs. Be aware that capacity wise the 3,200 RPM model more closely matches that of the Panda / Basecamp washer. Hope this helps!

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Loyal WMS4-C000674 Braided 3/8-Inch Washing Machine Connector, Stainless Steel" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: when I was turning off the water by turning clock wise water started to drip out is that normal? thanks in advance
Output:
output_field: If there is no drip when the water is on, but it started dripping when you were turning off the water, you need to replace the faucet. Feel for wetness with your fingers to find out where the water is coming from- if it is above where the hose connects, which in this case it most likely is, the faucet needs to be replaced, or at least new gaskets installed- I'd replace the faucet if that is the case. If that is dry, but is wet only at or below where you've attached the hose to the faucet, then the hose connector is where the leak is occurring. In this case, you probably will only need to replace a 25 cent rubber washer. Dry everything with paper towel or rag before checking where the leak I coming from. Plumbers tape is not an option- your seal is the rubber washer between the hose and the faucet, always check to make sure the rubber washers are in place. Hope this helps...
