input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "CH Products USB Combatstick 568 with 8-Way Switch & 128 Programmable Functions" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: whats the differ in fighter and combat stick?
Response:
output_field: There's some conflicts in these answers, so let me straighten things up. The Fighter replaces two push buttons with one 4-way hat and one 2-way hat. Other than that the Combat and Fighter stick are identical. They both have a throttle wheel left of the stick, and built in trim wheels for the x and y axes. Trim is a bit troubling on most sticks since you don't get the feedback on the controls as less stick pressure is required. Don't think that this makes this stick bad since any sim that has trim has this drawback unless you have a force-feedback stick that simulates this (those are almost impossible to find.) The extra hats are great for modern jet study sims, but if you are into games like IL-2, there are normally enough buttons. On the otherhand you can map a ton of functions to all the extra contols, and adding a throttle that has a lot of buttons means you may not even touch your keyboard ingame. The Fighterstick tends to be at least 20 bucks more, so if you want the extra functionality, that's the price.

input_field:
Instruction: In light of the product "Sony Xperia Z C6602 Unlocked Phone with 5 inch HD Display and 1.5GHz Quad-Core Processor--U.S. Warranty (White)" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: what it the different between c6602 and c6603? i using tmobile which one can use LTE?
Output:
output_field: T-Mobile uses LTE bands 1700/2100 The C6603 is the LTE version supporting LTE bands 800/850/900/1800/2100/2600. However, the C6603 only supports HSDPA bands 850/900/2100 The C6602 supports HSDPA bands 850/900/1700/1900/2100 so it work work fully on T-Mobile, but it is lacking LTE. The C6606 (T-Mobile variant) fully supports LTE and HSPA+. One thing to keep in mind though is that on the C6606 is going to be harder to flash custom ROMs to (if that's your thing) due to it's bootloader.

Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Kensington Proximo Key FOB Bluetooth Tracker for iPhone 5S/5C/5/4S and Samsung Galaxy S3/S4" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: Can you set it to ring your phone when you get a certain distance away?
Output:
output_field: Yes. It automatically sounds an alarm once the two parts get separated by a certain distance(I put the fob on my bag, and have my phone as the second part of the system) If I walk away from my bag, my phone sounds an alarm and then locks itself. That way if someone walks away from me and my bag, with my cell phone. The alarm on the bag and the phone both go off. The phone locks so if someone walks away with it, they cannot access and info in it, without knowing the code. It's likely that the alarm sounds can be customized-I'm not sure. I like the preset alarm sound. Everyone around perks up when they here it go off. You don't have to have your phone lock when the alarm sounds-its an opinion. Hope that helps.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Whirlpool W10214580RP Grey Top Load Washer/Dryer Cover" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: does the covering have to be removed for use of the machine? or does it have separate openings for the setting knobs as well as the cover of the machine?
Answer:
output_field: It does not have any openings for the knobs or for the doors of the machine, so it is a bit of an inconvenience. I have learned to accept that fact and work around it because it is still far easier than having to clean the machines off of all the dust and dirt (and rust) that accumulate on the machine since mine are outside. Having said that I do not fully remove the covers when using the machines. I simply lift up the front and pull it over just enough to open the door. For the washer, since the door is on top, it holds the cover open without any problem. For the dryer, I use the heavy detergent bottle to sit it on top holding the cover open. I then left up and over to access the knobs, and put it back when done. In order to be able to do this, I do not use the provided straps to tie the covers down, but since it is not windy enough where I live, I don't need them.

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Microlife PF 100 Peak Flow Meter for Spirometry with FEV1" answer the inquiry below.
Input: How long is it useable/effective? My doctor said it should be replaced after a year.
Output:
output_field: I expect that mine will last for years. Not at all cheap...very good quality. However...I did make a mistake in my review. The routine is to take 3 readings and the unit writes the highest value to memory. The catch is that it records the highest PEF , NOT NECESSARILY THE HIGHEST FEV1. IT DOES record both PEF and FEV1, BUT ONLY THE FEV1 TAKEN AT THE TIME THE HIGHEST PEF WAS GENERATED. THAT IS NOT NECESSARILY THE HIGHEST FEV1 VALUE OVERALL IF 3 READINGS ARE TAKEN. THAT CREATES A PROBLEM IF YOU ARE BUYING THIS TO MONITOR your BEST FEV1's. AS A RESULT, I HAVE TO WRITE DOWN EACH FEV1 AND THEN TRANSFER THE HIGHEST OF THE 3 READINGS TO A WRITTEN LOG. This RENDERS THEY'RE SOFTWARE USELESS FOR ME. I THEN GRAPH THEM BY HAND. I consider that a significant design flaw. good luck.

Instruction：Based on the product "SPT Countertop Dishwasher, White"，please give the answer for corresponding question.

Output：
output_field: The drain hose is actually one piece together with the quick connect faucet adapter. It is a one piece that snaps onto your kitchen faucet. You turn on your hot water and when necessary, it will fill the tub. Once it is time to drain the tub, it will empty directly into your sink. (this way, you don't have to worry about a single loose hose that may fall out of the sink and onto your floor.) It also has a bypass button on the connector to let you obtain water from the faucet while connected. Hope this helps!

output_field: It would take some modification, since the smoke only comes out when you squeeze the trigger. That causes the liquid to be squirted onto the heating element. I suppose you could rig up something where the heating element would be continually submerged in the liquid, but then you could probably do the same thing just by getting some nichrome wire (or steel wool?) and heating it up with batteries. Note that your batteries would not last long if they were being discharged continually.

Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Speed-Way MTT-GRY Grey Large/Touring Shelter", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: bouhgt it less than 1yr ago. It has deterioated completely. with just normal rain and sun. very bad quality in material. what is my warranty??????????
Response:
output_field: Talked to Speed-Way before I brought mine, as, in Arizona, the sun rots everything pretty quickly - The warranty on the cover is One Year.. It's not going to guarantee against fading, just tears and rips due to weather damage - that kind of thing... I have had mine for just about a year and my cover has also faded really bad, but it still looks pretty good and it does what I am paying it to do.. Keep my bike looking new by protecting it from weather damage. When I contacted the company before I made my purchase, I asked how much a replacement cover would cost - I was told $135.00 for the large (a year ago), which is not bad, considering my boat is costing me $680.00 each year to store and cover. As I see it.. If I can cover and protect my $20,000.00+ bike for $135.00 per year.. That's not bad. Nothing lasts forever, but this shelter is holding up for me really well.. For the fact that you can buy replacement covers "relatively" inexpensively, and the covers are warranted for a year was the only reason I brought this..

input_field:
Instruction：Based on the product "Paradise Tropical Tea, Decaffeinated Superior Tea, 1-Ounce Filter Packs (Pack of 50)"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：Why has the price of the decaf version of the Paradise tea risen to such a ridiculous price----i have bought it for years, starting at Trader Joes for around $2---then at Amazon at a reasonable price
Output：
output_field: The manufacturer did NOT discontinue the decaf blend. They did, however, discontinue ALL of the "retail-pack" items... The retail size were little yellow boxes with 4 small filter packs inside (each filter pack was 0.33oz). The 1oz filter packs (box of 50) you see here was always available, but was typically purchased by restaurants and the like (and tea addicts). At Coffee Wholesale USA, we have been selling Paradise tea since 1999, and have fielded many similar questions. Long story short, the reason it appears to be expensive is because it's not the pack size you're used to seeing. Actually, when you figure it out as $ per ounce, the 50/1oz pack size has always been less expensive...

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "Revlon RVSP3501B1 Moisturestay Quick Heat Paraffin Bath", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: I need the level of the wax to go about 1-2 inches above the position of a watch . The warmth is for my wrist -- will this unit be deep enough?
Output:
output_field: I needed the same thing because as a Lmt, my wrists take a lot of abuse. I don't have big arms or hands. But the unit was still not deep enough. We both need something where we can put our hands in from the top of the unit rather than the side of the unit. The bigger units which contain about 6 pounds of wax should do the trick. While it is true that you could cover your wrist if 1) there is an ample supply of wax, 2) you use a metal cup to scoop the wax onto your wrist 3) submerge the hand/wrist at a weird angle to make it work, and 4) keep dipping and turning your hand over a few times -- all of this extra effort isn't worth it. Soaking our hands/wrists should be hassle free, but with this unit it is not. Update: I returned the unit and within two days, my cc account has been refunded. Amazon has always been great to me when it comes to returns, which I don't do often. I am very grateful for Amazon's awesome return policy. Thank you Amazon.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Bob's Red Mill Gluten-Free Homemade Wonderful Bread Mix, 16-Ounce Packages (Pack of 4)", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: How much flour should be used for a bread-machine recipe?
Response:
output_field: I tried my own recipes/published and was never happy. Bob's Red Mill Homemade Wonderful Bread Mix makes a big loaf very superior to any commercial loaf I've found. Although I do put the mix into the bread machine to mix and rise, I transfer it to a loaf pan and finish it off in the oven according to the package instructions. You must cook it a lot longer than a regular bread machine baking cycle, according to the package instructions, and cover with foil to prevent crust burn. I don't separate the eggs, just use the whole egg. I substitute coconut oil for the butter. Wetting you fingers and smoothing out the top will really make a visual difference too. I keep this gluten free flour on hand for lots of other purposes. Breading fried chicken and some recipes you were using before that may call for a small amount of flour and this substitutes great. Good luck on your GF journey.

Instruction: In light of the product "Sennheiser ME 3-EW headset EW microphone" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: mic for voice recognition/dictation: That might be fine for some uses, but is there a different option for my needs that would still produce reliable quality?
Output:
output_field: There is the Andrea USB mic, http://www.amazon.com/Andrea-Electronics-NC-185VM-USB-Hi-Fidelity/dp/B003VW41G8/ref=pd_cp_MI_0 - at only about $44, no adapter required, which is specifically recommended by Nuance, as well as some version of Plantronics, however, reportedly there is nothing that is equal to the accuracy obtained by this Sennheiser, so it is up to you to choose what is most important. Read the reviews on the Andrea, as they are good. For my tastes, and knowing how finicky voice-to-text is, I am going to spring for the Sennheiser ME 3-EW. There is a list of approved hardware for use with DNS on nuance.com. It took some clicking around to find it, sorry I don't have the link. But these two are on the list. There is also a site called emicrophones dot com where they have tested the best equipment for use with DNS, and they sell this Sennheiser with a longer cord. Here's wishing the best of success to you in your endeavors.

Query: what all do I need to reload 223? I will handwash casings and besides primers and powder, but like rifle casing trimming, dies, etc?
Response:
output_field: You'll need a full-length die, a bullet seating die (these should come in a set with shell holders but if not, a shell holder), case lube and lube pad (Hornady case lube and RCBS lube pad work really well), a case neck brush, a priming system (Lee dies have a priming tool that installs into the shaft of the press, but they also make a hand priming tool), primer pocket cleaner, a case length gauge/trimming system (Lee makes good cheap ones), a digital caliper to measure overall length, bullets, powder, powder scale (funnel too), small rifle primers, and of course brass. I would recommend getting a tumbler too. I have a nano one that only cost around $30. If you get this kit, it comes with a powder scale and funnel and both priming systems I was talking about. It also comes with a drop tube for spent primers to keep them all together until its time to dump them.

Output:
output_field: L-Ascorbic acid (LAA) needs to be at an optimal pH of 3.5 or < to retain efficacy. Any pH less than that would render it ineffective.

Instruction: Based on the product "Aqueon 34500 ProFlex Sump Model 1, 44-55-Gallon" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: Does this sump come with the piping/tubing that leads to and from the tank? Also, does it come with any of the water pumps or plumbing?
Answer:
output_field: This does not come with a pump because that is a design choice that you must make yourself and is custom to each setup. It does come however with a very basic soft pipe you can use (however most people trash because it is not good quality) For plumbing, you are going to want to get something a tad more reliable like flex like tubing OR PVC depending on your preference. I personally like hard plumbing like PVC from the tank itself to about halfway down, then I switch to flex line tubing to connect it to the pump. Doing this allows more room under the tank and the vibrations from pump won't loosen anything up over time.

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "DHS Ping Pong Paddle A6002, Table Tennis Racket - Shakehand" answer the inquiry below.
Input: How is this paddle compared with A5002 and A4002?
Output:
output_field: I used the A4002, a great paddle for me, but I definitively feel the difference when swift to the A6002: the sponge is thicker so you can feel the difference when hit the ball. Since sponges are thicker the weight of paddle is towards the rubber area... so at the end you will have more torque and due to the thicker sponge a more spring effect, so it means more power!. So it is a positive upgrade. But you need to learn to control the paddle... you can feel the difference between paddles, A6002 is more sensitive to the effects and you need to learn to control the power too. In therms of physical appearance I prefer the black handle, but due to the performance... you forget this detail. I dont know about A5002, I prefer to jump to the A6002 and I think that it was a good idea to jump like this and avoid A5002.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "FiiO D3 (D03K) Digital to Analog Audio Converter - 192kHz/24bit Optical and Coaxial DAC", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: Will this work with just a computer? I currently use the headphone jack for my headphones, how would I use this to improve the sound quality? Thanks!
Response:
output_field: There are several issues here. If this DAC is better than the one your computer uses to output analog audio (out front panel or rear panel), which is likely, your computer has a digital optical and/or coaxial audio output, which is also likely, you have really good headphones or better a good audio system (preamp/amp/speakers), and you are generating the digital audio signal from something better than a MP3 file (from CD or HD audio source), then yes it should sound better! Also, I note the DAC which I no longer own only supports PCM, so that means CD quality at best. Finally, I note the DAC does not have a signal gain adjustment which may be very import if you are just pugging in headphones as the signal may be too weak (I can't test that since I since as I said I no longer have the DAC).

Instruction: Referencing the product "Quikrete 6921-34 Walk Maker", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: I have a plain concrete driveway, could I use this to pour over the existing driveway to get a design? Ergo: The weight of a vehicle?
Output:
output_field: As to the concrete and the weight of the vehicle, you will need to use a concrete thats rated to meet that requirement. You would also need to poor it deep enough that it wont chip off or crack. The design would be the easy part of it all and after just completing my project and where you are wanting to do this I would suggest turning this and using it as more of a stamp and not a deep cut. So by turning the mold on its top and using it as a stamp without a real deep cut like a path walkway you get the look of the stone and it looks great. You can really get a professional look without anywhere near the cost. I don't know how to post pictures on here or I would. I poored a large area and worked the concrete just as you would for a smooth surface then went back and stamped the area. I am staining the concrete this weekend. I hope this helps

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "TSSS Data Repeater RGB Signal Amplifier For SMD 3528 5050 LED Strip Light, DC 12V 12A, 2 years warranty" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: I NEED CONNECT 10 STRIPES WHAT DO YOU RECOMEND ME
Output:
output_field: Buy 4 of these 3 to 1 splitters (http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/61TemWV9nHL._SL1500_.jpg). Connect the single side to your 12V power supply then connect 1 TSSS Data Repeater (amplifier) to each of the 3 ends of the splitter (you will need 3 amplifiers). Use the other 3 splitters to connect 1 to each amplifier. This will give you 9 plug ins for your 9 lines and you will not have any power issues. This is probably overkill, but the parts are cheap and you are better off having more available capacity than too little. TIP: To keep things clean I attached heavy duty velcro to the back of each amplifier and the 12V power supply and stuck them to the wall. Buy way more wire (http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/71ekjJHHuAL._SL1500_.jpg) than you think you need and use these (http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41q%2BhzsWiQL._SL1500_.jpg) on the amplifier end of the wire and cut these in 1/2 then splice them on the light strip end (http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/71j87VtkuhL._SL1500_.jpg) to make everything "plug-and-play".

Instruction：Based on the product "Scosche BFGM GM LAN BlueFusion Interface Module for Factory Hands Free"，please give the answer for corresponding question.
Input：After comparing the sound quality of my JBL CD unit and the bluefusion from my iPhone 5 I hear some static with the Bluefusion and crystal clear from my JBL CD unit. Anyone? (same song from same file for comparison) Also my mic goes nutz when the car...
Output：
output_field: There should be no difference in audio quality as the Bluefusion utilizes your car stereo's system. As with any Bluetooth car kit, the troubleshooting is as follows: 1. Delete the current pairing and re-pair the Bluefusion with your phone, sometimes a bad Bluetooth connection can cause issues. 2. Pair the Bluefusion with another (different) phone to see if you can duplicate the problem, if you can, it is likely an issue with the Bluefusion, if you can't, it has something to do with the phone and it's pairing with the Bluefusion, it might need an update on either the phone or/and the Bluefusion. If there is still issues, you will need to contact Scosche Tech Support.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Sure-Pak MRE Full Meal Kit with Heater-Single Meal", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: Assuming the MRE's shelf life is 3-5 yrs, how do you know the starting date on what you are buying from /via Amazon? Surplus ones alreay expired?
Response:
output_field: The best website I have found is MREinfo.com - it illustrates how to figure the manufacturing date. What you are buying are either overruns or semi-official style MRE's. The companies that make these have figured out that the general public will buy these - so demand and supply kicks in. I would not buy any that are in the military brown wrappers because they have either been "liberated" from a military source or they are potentially quite old and/or were stored in less than ideal conditions. (Speaking as a retired vet myself). I think that it also pays to look at the calorie count & where those calories are coming from. Some of these MRE's derive too many calories from what I consider junk food - too many sugars, etc. IMHO.

Instruction: Concerning the product "Nature's Miracle Just for Cats Easy Care Crystal Litter, 8-Pound", answer the query provided below.
Question: How long does the 8# last, how much do you use each time, and about how long before it needs to be changed?
Answer:
output_field: I dump the entire bag in at once (I have a fairly big litter box) and how long it lasts depends entirely on how diligent I am about scooping it. I have two cats and if I scoop the litter every day or two (mixing it up a bit as I do) it will last me a month. If I neglect it for a few days it easily knocks a week off the longevity. It seems that stirring it and dispersing the saturated crystals makes a big difference.

input_field:
Instruction: In light of the product "Winco Champagne Bottle Stopper" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: What am I doing wrong? I've tried this on 2 bottles: Mumm Napa & Jaume Cristalino. When I latch the sealer there's too much play in the spring. Thx
Output:
output_field: Press the stopper onto the mouth of the bottle with the latches slightly open. With the stopper spring compressed, close the latches which should hook below the glass rim of the bottle opening. If the latches slide off the glass rim, which may happen due to slight variation in shape between wine brands, wrap a rubber band tightly around the closed latches to force them against the neck of the bottle. Turn the bottle on its side. It should not leak. If liquid does not leak out, then it is unlikely that gas will leak out either.

output_field: The k70 is a great buy for most all. The build quality of both the TK and the K70 are pretty close but K70 takes the pot. Your options on the k70 are huge brown, blue, and red switches coming in with either black aluminum or silver; n-key roll over easy-Access Dedicated Multimedia Controls etc. The K70 is sleek and professional looking to the point you can take it to work and use it there. Now, the CM Storm QuickFire TK is minimalistic you get what you get and thats it. Not talking down on the product, the product is great. When put side by side with the K70 though, the K70 is the clear choice. For all the options and great features its hard to go wrong with K70. Plus,(depending on what key switch you're getting) you're not spending that much more, but in the end you know where that little extra is going. To answer your Question: K70 is your choice.

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "Fender Mustang I V2 20-Watt 1x8-Inch Combo Electric Guitar Amplifier", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: I am a beginner and know a few chords. Finally decided it was time for an amp. I get a terrible hum whenever I am plugged in. Desperate for advice.
Output:
output_field: Hi, A hum is typically a ground issue resulting from a wiring problem with the outlet into which you've plugged the amp. It could also involve any effect pedal you're using. The amp itself should be dead quiet unless you're playing--it's a digital device, and a hum is analog. Unless the amp is defective, it's likely that a hum comes from somewhere else in the signal chain. You might try plugging the amp into an different outlet or power strip, trying your guitar through a different amp at a music store, or trying another guitar through your amp. This is a good amp and Fender wants you to be happy with it. Don't be shy about switching things around to isolate the problem, or asking for repair/replacement if the amp is found to be defective.

Instruction: Reflecting on the product "SKLZ Quick Flat Rung Agility Ladder with Free SKLZ Carry Bag" answer the inquiry below.
Input: Do recommend this for a runner to train?
Output:
output_field: Neuro muscular training or reactive training done on an agility ladder has many advantages for runners particularly trail runners. In any event these ladders when used in conjunction with an off season weight resistance program designed around intervals works great. Strive to know the foot patterns and as you do, do them as quickly as possible. Repeating the patterns. I typically have my clients do 2-3 weight movements follows with 2-4 times through the ladder then back into another 2-3 movements then a stretching interval of say 1-2 min as part of recovery. Then back into another 2-3 movements followed by a stint on the ladder. Be creative. There are numerous patterns. Hopping getting both feet off the floor adds another dimension to your fitness and coordination, tendon and ligament strength.

These things are made really well. i got one so I could get my Mom out the back patio door and up the back yard stairs, and then another smaller one to get her and the chair into the back of our mini-van so she doesn't have to get in and out of the wheelchair. They have been the best purchases I've made. I'm very impressed with the quality of the product. If you email Prairie, they will respond to you, their customer service is very good. I also leave the one for the backyard stairs out all year round, in snow, freezing rain and all, and it doesn't rust to decay or become compromised in any way. I highly recommend them.

output_field: Maybe. The main unit attaches to a mount via a magnet. The mount attaches to the wall/ ceiling via double sided tape. input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "Escali BFBW200 Glass Body Fat/ Body Water Digital Bathroom Scale, 440lb/200 Kg" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: Why doesn't the body fat measurement work? I have not been able to get the water or body fat to work. What's up?
Answer:
output_field: Make sure you're barefoot when using the scale to record anything but weight. Have you established your baseline? The scale needs to know your age, height and sex before it can use the body fat and water measurements. Instructions come with the scale, or you can download them here: http://www.escali.com/images/support/1351175302BFBW200%20manual.pdf Steps are: 1. Use arrow buttons to select a number (the scale records base height, age & sex for up to 10 people), press middle (enter, right angle arrow) button. 2. Use arrows to select sex, press enter. 3. Use arrows to select height, press enter. 4. Use arrows to select age, press enter. The scale will return to zero and should be ready to record body fat/ water percentage. Make sure you stay standing on the scale (with bare feet) until it completes the cycle and shows weight, bodyfat and water percentages. After baseline is saved, you can use one foot on the scale to cycle to your number (1-10) and use saved Age, Height, & Sex.

Instruction: In light of the product "Onsite Pro FS3/4H90 Washing Machine Valve Shutoff Kit" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: How does the shutoff kit work with a steam dryer connected to water supply?
Output:
output_field: This unit comes with the ability to connect more than one sensor. I put one sensor under my washer & purchased a second for under my dryer. I have a wye connector that splits the water going to the dryer and the washer. Should one of the sensors detect water, the solenoid valve will shut off. Once it shuts off, it will prevent water flow to either the washer or the dryer. A friend of mine did not have the shutoff kit & the hose going to his dryer developed a leak. Fortunately he was home & noticed the water flowing down the stairs to his basement. The sensors work as I tested each. I hope this answers your question.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Vision Bird Cage Model M02 - Medium" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: should I get the taller one for my conyer
Answer:
output_field: The bigger the better...always...almost. My little Lovebird was quite intimidated by all the over head space so I put the top half in a closet and if/when she gets a buddy there'll be twice the room. You may want to read up on your species of conure, as every one has different characteristics. I would want to be sure it is not a voracious chewer as theres a lot of plastic that could be damaged, but I think most, if not, all conures are fine. Conures like to fly and some are real screamers, which is easily stopped with a dark cover. Birds can't see in the dark and when in a new home require a lot of rest, even weeks covered to recover from the stress. You'll be very happy with the cage.

Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Misto Brushed Aluminum Olive Oil Sprayer", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: Has anyone tried using a plastic spray bottle instead? The kind that costs around $2 and has an adjustable nozzle from stream to mist?
Response:
output_field: The problem is viscosity. Due to the thickness of oils, they will not work well in a spray bottle and the spray nozzle will be clogged from the get go. H. The Misto paid for itself after the equivalent of about three cans of cheap pan spray and there is no silicon (a content of most commercial sprays) to worry about.

input_field:
Instruction: In light of the product "Logitech Wireless Gaming Headset G930 with 7.1 Surround Sound" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: Is the wireless quality really "Gaming grade"? Can anyone compare to the wired version of the product? I have that one now.
Output:
output_field: As a game developer, I use these headsets religiously. They are not the best quality, but compared to 90% of wired headsets near the same price range they are just as good. Only problems I have with the headset is the boom for the microphone. The elbow that attaches boom to the left headphone is made out of plastic and if dropped on that elbow it will break with ease. (I strength my headsets by attaching 38 gauge aluminum with some liquid steel adhesive, to the elbow join) I have used a number of these headsets and currently own three. Two for work and one for home. Being able to get up and get a drink or rush to a project meeting, without stressing about tripping over a cord or ripping the USB out is hard to beat. Hope this review helps, if you have any questions about the headset let me know and I'd be happy to answer them for you.

input_field:
Instruction: Concerning the product "Nuun Active Hydration, Electrolyte Enhanced Drink Tablets, Original Mixed Flavor 4-pack: Lemon+Lime, Tri-Berry, Orange, Citrus Fruit (4 Tubes/12 Tabs Per Tube)", answer the query provided below.
Question: Why in the world does Nuun put propylene glycol in their product?
Answer:
output_field: This is a common concern, raised because something "sounds scary," and it's often cited as "antifreeze." Propylene glycol does indeed lower the freezing point of water, and you can use it as anti-freeze, which says exactly nothing about its safety as a food ingredient. For the record, the chemical in car anti-freeze is ethylene glycol, which is toxic. Propylene glycol is considered non-toxic and is used as an anti-freeze for water pipes and in food production where ingestion is possible. You would have to consume massive amounts of the chemical, impossible from food, in order to get anywhere near toxic levels. Also, I should note that, technically, TABLE SALT can be considered "anti-freeze."

Instruction: Using the details of the product "Andersen-3604 Camper Leveler" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: I can see that on firm ground these may work but how do they perform on loose dirt, sand, or gravel? Do they stay in place or do they skid easily?
Response:
output_field: I have used them now on several types of surfaces from grass to crushed stone and smaller gravel to sand and feel they are a great leveling system. When I use them on a softer surface I make sure to over level to allow for them to settle a bit. One negative is the slippery surface of the wedge part that can allow the two pieces to slip a little but I am going to add some traction tape to them to stop that from happening. So far I am very satisfied and find it a simple and easy way to level my 27 foot travel trailer correct the first try. Hope this helps.

input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "Hoover Air Pro Bagless Upright, UH72450" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: How does this compare to the Air, Air Pro, and Air Steerable which I'm also interested in?
Answer:
output_field: I also have the Air Steerable. The steerable is lighter in weight and does not have a place to put the small power brush on the unit. It also doesn't have auto-rewind. My biggest complaint is that I cannot vacuum my low pile area rugs. It requires too much effort. I guess the suction is just too strong. There is no height adjustment, either. It is a little easier to push on a wall-to-wall carpet, but would still give quite a workout. This one is heavire, but it is easier to push on my area rug. Not great, but definitely easier. More like the steerable on the wall-to-wall. Both are easy to assemble and both are easy to empty the dirt cup. They both work well on tile and wood floors. The steerable is nicer on that because it is easy to steer! If you have many area rugs, I think you would be disappointed in the steerable, as I was and I have noticed other reviews saying the same thing. Even Hoover's customer service mentioned complaints about it not pushing on area rugs. Oh yes, this one also has a headlight while the steerable does not.

input_field:
Instruction: Concerning the product "Uni-Trend UT202A Auto-ranging AC 600 Amp Clamp Meter", answer the query provided below.
Question: Will this meter diagnosis relay problems on vehicle air conditioners or do I need to purchase the more expensive version for that?
Answer:
output_field: I.m not sure why you specifically mention relays on vehicle air conditioners, as if that would take a special meter. However, this little inexpensive meter does have the ability to measure volts, both AC and DC, ohms, amps, check capacitors, diodes, do a continuity check, and resistance checks. So, depending what you are wanting to check, I think it would serve the purpose just as well as a more expensive one, if you are worried about cost. I really don't know what else you would need for checking a relay, whether on a vehicle air conditioner or any other piece of equipment. Most of the time you either want to know !. is it getting power, 2.are the points open or closed, 3. is the power getting across the contacts, or 4. is the relay coil burned out or not. So yes, I think this would do what you want it to do, and for a good price. For home use, or a DIYer, this is a good little tool.

Instruction: Using the details of the product "Aerb® Newest Removable Wireless Bluetooth Keyboard Case Auto Sleep Wake for Apple iPad Air iPad 5 W Magnetic Tablet Stand (iPad 5 & iPad Air, Red)" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: How to used the volume on and off and play button on the wireless keyboard?
Response:
output_field: Michie: When watching a video (such as You tube) hold down the Fn (bottom left of keyboard) key and the Speaker key on the number 0 to mute the Audio, to the right of that if you hold down the Fn key and hit the Speaker down Volume it will play softer and one more key to the right of that hold down the Fn key and Volume up key to increase the volume on the video. Holding Down the Fn key and the play pause key (on the number 8) will stop and start the video. When playing Music tracks all the previous mentioned keys work as mention before but you can also use the next track key Fn (9) and previous track key Fn (7) to navigate back and forth on the tracks. Hope this answer was helpful to you. Mark

Output:
output_field: Maybe... There are three issues - hardware to connect the receiver to the iPad, whether the iPad will recognize the pointer function. The unit's wireless receiver plugs into a standard USB port, which the iPad does not have. Instruction: Based on the product "Behringer MA400 Monitor Headphone Amplifier" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: Does this serve the same purpose as the Behringer MX400 Micromix 4 Channel Line Mixer in a way if I can get the signal to be stereo? thanks
Answer:
output_field: they are both mono input only units. the MA 400 mixes two mono sources (one mic level and one line level) to a stereo headphone out. the MX400 mixes 4 mono line sources to a mono line out; i do suppose you could run the left/right sides of stereo output into two separate inputs and combine to the mono output. is that what you're asking? and the ma400 boosts the signal enough to push a pair of headphones- so the purposes of the two units are very different.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Marantz CD6005 Hi-Fi Compact Disc Player with USB-A DAC", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: Anybody has experience in using it with high impedance headphones? How does the headphone module work?
Response:
output_field: The marketing mumbo jumbo that John quotes sounds nice but is false when it says "features the ability to properly drive the widest variety of headphone types, regardless of impedance or sensitivity". It will not "properly" drive all headphone types. In fact I think it is under-powered for any headphones over 50 ohms impedance. I tested it with my apple ear buds and half volume is about as loud as I would want to go but with my 50 ohm headphones I have the volume maxed out and wish I could go higher. So the honest truth is that they really skimped on the headphone amplifier on this product. The best review I have found on this product is from Don Disbennett at hometheaterhifi and he talks about this as well from his testing with HD598 headphones. The companion amplifier, PM6005, has a great headphone amplifier section that can drive any headphones however.

Instruction: With reference to the product "BatteryMINDer Charger/Maintainer/Desulfater - 12V, Model# 2012" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: if the Battery Minder 2012 is plugged into AC power and the cigarette lighter of a Ford van for 6 days,why didn't it charge the 2-1/2 yr. old battery?
Answer:
output_field: Battery may require a jump if cell is still good----the minder has feature on display that indicates if cell is dead, charging and desolating, any load on the battery meaning it is being DRAINED----what is registering on the battery minder indicator/display? If battery is too flat a jump is required. Batteries can be dead after any time or an unknown amount of time. Many locations such as Auto Zone may be storing them for long periods before they are sold to the customer My Chevy Impala was dead at 6 months---a Dura Gold long life battery---they switched it our for warranty.

input_field:
Instruction: Concerning the product "Dritz 223 5/8-Inch by 13-Yard Stitch Witchery, Super", answer the query provided below.
Question: What is the difference between the regular Stitch Witchery and the "super"?
Answer:
output_field: The difference between the Regular and the Super Stitch Witchery is that the super will give more bonding power to the fabric since it's a bit more dense in texture! For example, wool or any type of heaver fabric will bond to it self a bit better using the Super Stitch Witchery, on the other hand silk or any lighter type of fabric will bond to itself just fine with Regular Stitch Witchery. But please don't for get that the ultimately bonding out come will be in the ironing process! So please follow the information given on the instruction panel of the wrapper! Because weather you purchase Regular or Super if you don't gauge your iron to the satisfactory temperature then the fuse tape might not melt well! and this can leave you with your project not being properly fused together. Hope this helps.

Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Music City Metals 67233 Gloss Cast Iron Cooking Grid Set Replacement for Select Brinkmann Gas Grill Models" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: I have a Brickmann Pro Series Model 7541 Gas Grill. Will these Grill Grids work for this model?
Output:
output_field: The 67233 replacement is 3 grids total measuring 27" (9" each x 3) by 17.625". The Model 7541 pro gas grill replacement grids from Brickmann are described in the replacement parts manual as (9" x 17.75) so the difference is 0.125" front to back. If your grill has an edge or "lip" that the grid sets on, (front and back) and the edges or "lip" is greater than the 0.125" this 67233 grid will work. Remember that the 67233 is 3(9") wide grids (side to side) covers 27". Good Luck! I hope that answers your question.

Instruction: With reference to the product "Pentair 516112 Handle Basket Replacement Bermuda Gunite and Vinyl Liner Skimmer" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: I noted one comment that the unit is slightly smaller-- how small? I need a diameter of 81/4 inches. Also, is the unit at all flexible? Finally, is it heavy duty?
Answer:
output_field: Hello, I purchased two of these for my PacFab (now Pentair) skimmers, and they work perfectly... The measurement across the top is exactly 8 1/4" if measured end to end above the handle, however if measured across the handle it is exactly 8 1/8". So it would seem to be slightly egged due to the pressure the handle puts on it. I had never even noticed until taking these measurements for you. The other specs seem exactly as the oem pacfab basket's are. The basket is not really flexible at the reinforced top, but is somewhat bendable on the sides. I would call it heavy duty... As I remember things, it seems to be just about what my pool came with but that was 24 years ago. By the way, that OEM spec for the top rim from Pentair is 8 5/16" but I am willing to bet it is somewhat egged too. The handle is very strong, so it pushes on the basket slightly. I hope this has helped. Darrell W. Fort Worth, Texas

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "R22 Refrigerant, 30 Lb Disposable Tank" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: Will R-134 freon technically work in a system that uses R-22? or R-12? The term "work" is a scientific term of physics/Mechanical Engineering
Response:
output_field: All AC systems are engineered specifically for only one refridgerant. This is because each refridgerant has it's own requirements and specifications as to how it must be pressurized, what oils must be used, and what ability it has to efficiently cool. A system built for R22 or R12, will be built to accept different pressures and will use different oils than a system built to run R134. This is why for the most part, refrigerants are not interchangeable between various systems. My understadning, is R134 is not as efficient as R22, and will cause an increased load on the compressor, resulting in system failure.

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Boardwalk 6180 Bath Tissue, Two-Ply, White, 500 Sheets per Roll (Case of 96)" answer the inquiry below.
Input: How many sq feet in a case of this toilet paper anyone know?
Output:
output_field: Based on my calculations, each sheet is 3" x 4.5". There are 500 of those per roll, which is 6750 sq in per roll. 96 rolls per case, so 648,000 sq in per case, which translates into 4,500 sq ft. Here are some fun conversions too! 4,500 sq feet translates to : 500 sq yards 0.103 acres 1.61 x 10^-4 square miles 4.18 x 10^-4 square km This is: 1.6 times the area of a doubles tennis court (2808 sq ft) 2.6 times the area of a volleyball court (162 sq meters) 0.8 times the wing surface area of a Boeing 747-400 (525 sq meters) 6 times the averages surface area of a human lung (70 sq meters) Hope that answers all of your questions. :)

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "The Hubsan X4 H107 R/C Micro Quad Copter 2.4GHZ" answer the inquiry below.
Input: what is difference between this and the new improved x4h107? or is it the same copter
Output:
output_field: The original version was rather limited in range at about 35 Ft where they claim around 100 for the 'improved' version The antenna that you see on the transmitter is a dummy and is actually inside the main case .It was the norm for people to do slight mods to the board increasing the range and all they have done is to do the same mods on the production models . They have also added LED lights alongside each engine pod which does nothing really for performance but adds a bit of 'bling' to the model . They claim some changes to the electronics board but I have fitted a new board to an earlier model where could not se any differance Still a nice little starter copter ,little bit twitchy but very soon overcome . Plenty information about this on RC Groups dot com

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "New Serola Sacroiliac Belt, X-Large hip 46-52"", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: How would this work as SI support while driving?
Response:
output_field: When in a seated position, it may ride up a little. I wear the belt over my clothes, so I just quickly lower the belt if needed. But I need to add that long car rides...over an hour...usually hurt regardless. I have been 'in place' for almost 4 months now, and have been using the belt for 7 months. The apparatus that makes car rides pain free for me is the Sacrowedgy. It is under $40. You place it under your coxyc while driving. It is not a seat cushion. I have made a few 3.5 hour trips to a city I am relocating to. I have used the Sacrowedgy each time, and I finish the trip pain free! In addition to a hypermobile SI joint, I also have a slipped L4/L5 disc that was diagnosed at the same time.

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "Garritan Personal Orchestra 4", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: Does anyone know whether or not the sounds in GPO4 are better than the ones supplied in Finale? Are the strings more real sounding? Etc.
Output:
output_field: I cannot answer... I bought this product thinking it would be easy to install and use. Frankly, it was not worth it and I still have not been able to figure it out. There is no manual, and their customer "non-service" speaks only computerese. So if you're a geek, go for it. But I cannot and have not been able to get the danged thing to work, and for the money they're charging, there should be a manual on how to use it with ALL music software. I'm an organist and harpsichordist... I shudder at when they will figure out harpsichords have more than 8' registers. Or that there are pedal harpsichords, period strings, brass, or woodwinds. Then there will be more to offer in a program that, from my point of view, is impossible to use. It was a total waste of money for me. Their sounds may be great (I have no idea!)... but it's a program designed by and for computer geeks, not musicians. If you have better luck with it, let me know.

Instruction: Based on the product "Fascinations Levitron Revolution Platform With EZ Float Technology" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: Must this item be plugged in and powered to work? or is the power plug strictly just for the 4 LED lights?
Answer:
output_field: It must be plugged in. it's an electromagnet it needs the energy to create an electromagnetic field to push the floatable magnet up and away from the base magnet. It is very inyeresting to watch but don't be surprised if every nut case you show it to touches it and makes the two magnetic slam together-scratching and denting the base unit. There is a rubber cover for the floating magnet and I suggest keeping it on when you show 'anyone'...it saves some of the dents and scratches. Good Luck!

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Cherub WCP-60V Violin Pickup" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: I'm planning on purchasing this for a viola. How do I clip this on to the F holes without damaging the instrument?
Answer:
output_field: I was also worried about damaging my violin when I was looking through possible pickups to buy -that is the beauty if this pickup design; its doesn't involve invasive installation, and can be removed at any time. Attached to the mike (the disk shape with the Cherub logo imprint) is the spring-loaded, crescent-shaped arm that you pull back and slip inside the F hole of your instrument. The arm holds the mike in close contact with your instrument, but doesn't damage it in any way. The fact that I didn't have to alter my instrument at all was the deciding factor in my purchasing the Cherub pickup. Its quick and easy to use! I'm not sure how the sound quality compares with other, more expensive pickups -but the rest of my band can certainly hear me now.

Instruction: Pertaining to the product "FIIO D3 (D03K) Digital to Analog Audio Converter with SMI Gold Plated 6ft Optical TOSLink Cable and RCA-to-3.5MM Audio Cable- 192kHz/24bit Optical and Coaxial DAC", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.

Response:
output_field: As long as you can set your TV audio to PCM output ... Here's the review I wrote (upon returning the item): There's nothing in the listing about needing to set TV to "PCM Output only," and that's only possible in some settings on the TV, not for streaming, which was why I purchased this - to be able to use headphones when watching programs while my wife reads. Then, when it arrived, I saw a sticker on the converter and separate "notice" that both say the converter "will only work with PCM Output." (That's "pulse-code modulation" by the way, a form of sampling.)

input_field:
Instruction: In light of the product "Hohner SPC Case of Five Special 20 Harmonicas in Zippered Carrying Case" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: Are these Special 20's made in Germany or are they from China? I saw one seller ships from China, and I was somewhat concerned.
Output:
output_field: There are no markings on them to indicate they are from China except for the case they came in. My first order of the 20's had 3 defective, the re-order had 4 defective, that is holes that either didn't work or partially sounded and not necessarily in tune. I tried contacting a host of people to find if these 20's were China produced or some after market scam. I assumed the great Hohner German workmanship would not have such lax quality control. The best I got was to ship the defective harps to American techs ( my cost) where they would repair and ship back to me at their cost. Quite unsettling for a former trusted product, it should carry a buyer beware rider. Maybe buy them where you can try them, then you can do the return right at the purchase source. Hope this helps, Bruce

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Schwinn Men's GTX-2 700C Dual Sport Bicycle, Red/Silver, 18-Inch" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: what size are the tires? I would like a wider tire like a mountain bike but with a road bike tread pattern
Answer:
output_field: These tires are a "hybrid" of sorts. The sidewall of the tires reads (40-622) 700X38C. The width is approx 1 1/8"; my son's mountain bike tires measure 2 1/4"... a road bike tire is approx 7/8". The tread pattern is more of a v-tread design with a tread depth of about 1/16"; a mountain bike tire is knobby with a depth of 1/4"... a road bike is a straight tread with a depth of 1/32" or less. These tires are suitable for surfaces which are paved, packed cinder/dirt or low-cut grass. I wouldn't consider doing any serious "off-roading" with these tires due to their relatively narrow width and shallow tread depth. I took a couple of pictures; but, I can't upload them in this forum. I hope this helps.

Instruction: Using the details of the product "Jacquard Tie Dye Kit" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: Do you have to use 100% cotton fabric itemsor will it work on cotton/poly blends?
Response:
output_field: Yes. You need to use 100% cotton or other natural fabric for best results. If you want to dye poly, it takes a special product for synthetics. If you dye with blends, the poly part will not dye. The cotton part will. It might be an interesting effect. Try a small piece and see what you get. Plus, things loose a lot of brightness as the colors set and dry. And you may lose more color when you first wash the garment. And that kit will not dye 15 shirts. More like 5.

Instruction: Using the details of the product "Gamo Recon Whisper Air Rifle with 4x 20 Scope" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: is the co2 more powerful than the pump, I miss my second shot for having to pump for the next shot
Response:
output_field: No it is not, the air tank the air rifle has is bigger than any CO2 catridge. Also, an air rifle always will have the same air pressure, the CO2 doesn't, you will be losing power after each shot during the CO2 catridge lasts. My advice, is to try to shot from different positions until you get used to it, it won't make any difference if you learn how to calculate the distance from the target knowing how powerful the rifle is.

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "PetSafe Busy Buddy Kibble Nibble Meal Dispensing Dog Toy" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: how did you get your dog started using this? my boy seems leery of it. i have started feeding him his kibble out of an OPEN Kibble Nibble to see if t
Response:
output_field: It is very loud on linoleum or hardwood floors. Perhaps he is afraid of the noise. My Jack Russell doesn't care...he bangs it all over the kitchen. I started by putting small pieces of treats he really likes in it. I shook a couple pieces out on the floor and then pushed the Kibble Nibble around with my foot so he could see the food coming out. It did not take him long to figure it out. Then when I switched to his kibble (Beneful for small dogs), I made sure he was good and hungry before putting it down and nudging it with my toe. He did the rest. Also, you can trim the little plastic feelers in the ends of the Kibble Nibble if the food is larger and too hard to get out. My dog bolts his food so I wanted it to be a challenge. I trimmed one end shorter so it comes out a bit easier but still requires him to "work" for his food. If the noise it makes hitting the floor is the issue, get a piece of carpet to put it on. Hope this helps!

output_field: As far as I know, that is a feature of the software you use on the computer. Personally, i do it a different way with photoshop's crop and straighten and automate this process. First i scan all the images putting as many as possible on the scanner. Then I automate photoshop to run the crop and straighten on a whole folder of scans. It quickly opens each scan, crops each one. Then saves each one into a different folder. Once it is done I can quickly look through all the photos. I find this faster then manually picking which ones to keep. It does take a little know how to set up the process but once you do it will do all the hard work for you.

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "Medtronic LifePak 500 AED Non-Rechargeable Battery" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: WHAT ARE THE EXPIRATION DATES?
Response:
output_field: In theory, the battery should be replaced when the expiration date is reached. In reality, the battery may br fine long after that, especially if it is stored in a cool, dry place and is not in the AED doing a self-test on a regular basis. Obviously, the batteries are highly overpriced for what they are. A biomedical technician can replace the lithium batteries inside the housing for a lesser price. Over time, getting the rechargeable SLA (sealed lead-acid) battery and charger will cost more up-front but over a decade would save you money. This would be particularly valuable for an AED that is used often. I try to always have a spare battery with any AED, as you don't want to have a dead machine when it's really needed.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "DMC DC90 Water Soluble Cross Stitch Canvas, 8 by 8-1/2-Inch, White, 14 Count", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: how do i get MY DESIGN onto the canvas in order to embroider it onto the fabric? I need specific instructions as I have drawn a blank on how to do thi
Response:
output_field: You DON'T put the design onto the soluble canvas. After you baste the soluble canvas onto your chosen fabric you stitch through BOTH the soluble canvas and your chosen fabric using the chart of the design and counting the stitches.. When you have finished all the design you wet the soluble canvas and chosen fabric with warm water. Move it around in your hands and soon the soluble canvas will begin to disappear. You are left with design on your chosen fabric. Have you cross stitched before? Perhaps you could watch an instruction video on "How to cross stitch" on YouTube.

Instruction: Referencing the product "Schwinn Roadster 12-Inch Trike (Red)", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: How well does this trike pedal through grass? How about hills and grass....different terrain in general?
Output:
output_field: The tires have good traction, so it pedals uphill and downhill well, but it is a tough work-out on little legs. I also would keep it on even terrain; tricycles have a weird center of gravity that I don't fully understand. But, if they turn the trike too fast, try and cut a corner too close, the inside wheel loses surface contact. If they are riding over uneven surfaces, I think it would make it unsteady/unstable. We keep ours on the sidewalks, and inside the house.

input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "Photive CYREN Portable Wireless Bluetooth Speaker with Built in Speakerphone 8 hour Rechargeable Battery - Black" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: My ph-BT1000 can't pair with my Ipad Air nor my laptop. It paired with my Iphone OK, is there any updates or patches that can improve discoverability?
Answer:
output_field: It is likely still paired with your IPhone. Once the speaker is paired with a device it remains paired to that device. Turn Bluetooth off on your IPhone and put the speaker back into pairing mode (power down, wait 10secs and power back on). You will know it is in pairing mode when it flashes Red and Blue. Keep in mind the speaker will automatically pair with any previously paired device thereby blocking any other new device pairings.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Big Gator Tools V-DrillGuide Standard Size Portable Drilling Guide" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: If you mark the spot for your hole with a pencil dot, how do you position the guide so that you will be drilling in that exact spot? Thank you.
Output:
output_field: I would thread your chosen bit (the bit has not been chucked up yet) through the appropriate hole while lifting the drill guide a bit so you can see the tip of your bit and your pencil mark. Then press the bit tip into your pencil mark so the bit doesn't change positions when you ease the drill guide down on the wood. Now clamp the drill guide in place so it can't move, while continuing to hold it in place with your free hand. Now chuck the bit and drill your hole, knowing that you will drill through your pencil mark.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "JBL EON 518S Portable 18-inch 500-Watt Self-Powered Subwoofer", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: What is the correct polarity for large venues?
Response:
output_field: Polarity has nothing to do with venue size. Speakers have drivers, which vibrate forward and backward very quickly to make sound. If you have two speakers totally in phase, they will vibrate forward and backward at the same time. If they are totally out of phase, one goes forward while one goes back. This will make the sound quieter than if you had just one speaker. You want your subs, mains, and any other speakers you have to be in phase, if they are not then you can reverse the phase on the subs, which will cause them to move back when they were moving forward and forward when they were moving back, and hopefully that will realign the phase of all of the speakers.

Instruction: Pertaining to the product "FLIR Systems FLIR E4 Thermal Imaging Camera, 80 x 60 with MSX", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: Does the software run on windows 8.1? Any hint on how record video on windows?
Response:
output_field: FLIR Tools supports Windows 8 (32-bit and 64-bit), does NOT support Windows 8 RT. You'll need the standard FLIR drivers, and also "FLIR IR Camera Player" from http://www.flir.com/thermography/americas/us/view/?id=50428 Keep in mind, all FLIR Ex video output is always 9 frames/second. The driver used needs to handle the FLIR as a USB webcam operating as a UVC device, and the FLIR E4 needs to be in "RNDIS and UVC" mode. (Go to Settings->Device settings->Camera Information->Model and then hold right for 12 seconds to get to the USB mode menu.)

Instruction: Based on the product "Logitech G27 Racing Wheel" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: has anybody tried this in ps4/? does it work
Answer:
output_field: this is the answer i got for the same question I am positive that the G27 will not work in the PS4 for now because of the absence of a Sony PS4 security chip in it. Without this chip, the G27 shuts down in 8 minutes. This is how Sony protects its PS4 license. It may work in the future if Logitech manages to negotiate a deal with Sony. The 8-minute shutdown restriction can surely be circumvented by a firmware upgrade. There is actually a petition going around among G27 owners for that to happen.

Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Razer Orbweaver Mechanical PC Gaming Keypad" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: So, I gather the D-Pad is more sensitive than that of the nostromo n52. Owners: did you get used to it? I want to use it for WASD.
Output:
output_field: I've never used the Nostromo, but I can tell you that the D-Pad is very sensitive in my opinion. It has a good solid click to it, and each of the 8 positions can be mapped to whichever keys you like. The only problem I've had is that the 4 diagonal positions are very hard to achieve without first actuating one of the "polar" positions. In other words, say you wanted position 2 which would be between W and D in your case. I've found it's nigh impossible to actuate position 2 without actuating either W or D first on accident. But if you are primarily using it for the polar values, it works pretty well.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "BABYBJORN Travel Crib Light 2, Silver" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: how sturdy is it? can an angry toddler knock it over?
Output:
output_field: Anything is possible, but I think it would depend on the size/strength of your toddler. The base sits on the floor and is much wider than the top. Even if baby tried to run the length of the cot in an attempt to flip it, 1) I think the padded mattress would slow him/her down and 2) because the top is smaller, I don't think baby could get up to a speed that could cause the cot to tip. However, if the cot was close enough to a solid object (ex: nightstand) and baby was tall/strong enough, either the cot or object could move. There is a height max on this cot. I sold our pack-n-play and bought this new for our third kid and haven't regretted it. We have been traveling all summer and it is infinitely better than standard pack-n-plays.

input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "Little Giant Ladder Systems 15422-001 Velocity 300-Pound Duty Rating Multi-Use Ladder, 22-Foot" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: What are the physical differences between this Velocity model and the Revolution model shown on the Little Giant website?
Answer:
output_field: On the Little Giant website, go to the "What's New" section, and those are the features the Revolution model offers above and beyond this model. To recap, the Revolution is approx. 20% lighter, has a quad-lock hinge (4 pins instead of 2 in the lock), and due to the new pins, it has a new lever called a "Rock Lock", which is a push and release lock on the sides to adjust the ladder. While any sort of weight reduction is a good thing (when still rated for the same load), don't let this weight reduction fool you into thinking the original model is overly heavy. I have the 22' model, and I find it easy to move around. The quad locks are debatably useful, as I have never felt my 2 pin design was unstable or even the least bit wobbly. The redesigned release locks do sound nice however, as the original ones take a little getting used to.

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "Beyerdynamic DT 770 PRO, 250 ohms", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: If I purchase these 770s @ 250ohms what amp would I need for my Yamaha R-S201 receiver?
Output:
output_field: I'd start by just plugging right into your receiver and see how you like the sound. some receivers have decent headphone amps, others have horrid ones. I don't know your model, but my Yamaha has the horrid type unfortunately. if you find you don't like the sound, be it too muffled, thin, or lifeless, then add an amp. there are many you can add. I run mine on a schiit vali and I love the pairing. the schiit magni is a good amp as well, more versatile than the vali. there is the jds labs o2 amp, and many many more. you'll need a line out from your receiver though. I was shocked to learn mine did not have any line level outs, so I had to run an optical out to an optical dac, and connect my headphone amp to the dac.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Sandusky MWS301460 Light Duty Mobile Wire Shelving Unit, 30" Width x 60" Height x 14" Depth, 5 Shelves, Silver", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: What is the depth from the outside of one wheel to the outside of the opposite wheel - we have a limited space area.
Response:
output_field: The wheels add about 2 inches each. Since they would typically be pointed in the same direction, like this: bb, the overall depth would be approx. 16 inches. If, for some reason, they are pointed in opposite directions, like this: db, then it would be around 18 inches. However, if the wheels are pointing to either side, instead of front or back, they would add about 0.5 inches to the depth each, so overall it would be approx. 15 inches deep in such an instance. In summary, depending on how the wheels are pointed, the depth could vary from around 18 to 15 inches.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Crown XLS1000 Power Amplifier" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: What type of inputs and outputs does this amp have?
Answer:
output_field: The previous answer was right with a few exceptions: the inputs are balanced (3-wire) for XLR and 1/4-inch; unbalanced (2-wire) for RCA phono-jack inputs. The 1/4-inch phone jack inputs are definitely balanced, but these can easily be used to provide unbalanced if necessary (which shouldn't be if one wants to use the supplied RCA jacks). Unbalanced RCA works fine for short cable lengths and consumer or home use; balanced should be used with long cable runs and for maximum low-noise, low-hum performance. Audio outputs are the standard professional 4-Pole Speakon connectors (these can accept either 2-Pole or 4-Pole connectors depending on application) and Binding Post Output Jacks that accept the standard 3/4-inch width Banana Plug, spade-lug or plain wire connections. The European version of this amp does have plastic plugs inserted to prevent the accidental insertion of the European power plugs from being inserted into the output connectors -- something that would not be pretty. Note that the US version of the XLS amplifier doesn't come with the plugs inserted.

Instruction: Concerning the product "Penetrex® - The World's #1 OTC Anti-Inflammatory Therapy | 2 Oz. (60ml) :: Chosen By Sufferers of Tennis Elbow, Carpal Tunnel Syndrome, Arthritis, Bursitis, Tendonitis, Plantar Fasciitis, Sciatica, Fibromyalgia, Shin Splints, Neuropathy, and Other Inflammation Related Ailments - Formulated with Arnica, Vitamin B6 & MSM", answer the query provided below.
Question: Anyone used this for plantar fasciitis?
Answer:
output_field: I have. I use it every morning as soon as I wake up, before I take my first step, and it did more for me in three days than everything else I'd tried combined. I massage it directly into my heel, and around, making sure to seek out the little knot in my heel, then I put sock on to keep my feet warm/cushioned and go. I try to do it again in the afternoon and/or evening, but mornings are a must. I'm still struggling with the fasciitis, but if I skip this step I notice almost immediately, even with all the stretching, shoes, inserts, etc.

Instruction: With reference to the product "Glutino Gluten Free Pantry Favorite Sandwich Bread Mix, 22-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)" please provide an answer to the question below.

Answer:
output_field: I've been using this bread mix for years. Are you making it in a bread machine? I only use 1/2 the amount of butter and I cut back on the amount of water as well. I add the eggs to a measuring cup and fill it will it with water until it reaches 1 3/4 cups. It always comes our perfect.I store the bread in plastic wrap and place it in the fridge. I slice it up the next day. It will crumble if you slice it while it's still warm. To use the bread I place a couple of slices in wax paper and microwave for 45 seconds or so. Hope that helps.

Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Honeywell Long-Life Pure HEPA QuietCare Air Purifier, 17000" answer the inquiry below.
Input: Do you have to buy filters for this? and would this be good enough for a large living room?
Output:
output_field: It comes with a HEPA filter and a charcoal pre-filter. I would suggest buying a pack of replacement charcoal pre-filters at the time of purchase because they get used up every three months or so. I think that they reccommend it for use in rooms that are 168 square feet (12 by 14 feet). I use it in a larger room, and I think that it does accomplish something (I see less floaties, smell less kitchen odors), but its not as effective as the unit I run in my bedroom, which is a smaller area. If you have serious allergies and this is the solution I would buy a unit that is suggested to run in the size room that you have. If you're a mild allergy sufferer, then it may do well enough for you in a larger room.

Instruction: With reference to the product "JET JWL-1221VS 12-Inch by 21-Inch Variable Speed Wood Lathe" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: Do you need to move a belt to change speeds? Or is there a dial or switch?
Answer:
output_field: This lathe has a variable speed controller, so the speeds may be changed using the simple rotating knob. To provide speed ranges to suit any situation, especially for the more experienced turner, there is a three step pulley. This arrangement allows the variable speed controller to adjust speeds from 60 to 900 rpm on the low step of the pulley, 110 -1800 rpm on the 2nd step (medium), and a high speed range of 220 -3600 rpm on the the 3rd step. The belt need only be changed if you want to move to a different range of speeds. This is a very simple process.

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Garritan Instant Orchestra" answer the inquiry below.
Input: I have bought this since a year and i still cannot play it on my computer.It`s rubbish.How to make the software play on my computer?
Output:
output_field: Hi. Assuming that your computer puts out normal Windows sounds (speakers not muted) and assuming that the Garritan I.O. software is properly installed and activated on your PC, there should be a standalone program called Aria Player on your desktop. When launched, be sure to check TOOLS/PREFERENCES to see if your sound card and format type are listed correctly. If your sound card is not supported, you can download freeware called 'ASIO4ALL' -Also check that your midi keyboard or other trigger device is selected to input notes. If you have no such devices, you can use the on-screen keyboard that comes with the product. To test sound output, load up an "ensemble" and click on the highlighted keys to see what you get. Hope this helps.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Whirlpool 4396701 / 9915 Quarter-Turn Top Mount Refrigerator Water Filter, 1-Pack" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: I purchased a #9915 replacement filter and can't seem to get it to turn and snap into place. Any suggestions or can anyone tell me what I am doing wrong? Seems so simple, but it just won't snap into place, very hard to turn.
Answer:
output_field: nstructions 1. Twist the old filter a quarter-turn counterclockwise 2. Pull the filter straight out (don't worry, the water will shut off automatically) 3. Remove the reusable color-keyed knob from the end 4. Discard the old filter 5. Slide the knob onto the end of the new filter 6. Push the new filter into the fridge until it stops 7. Twist the filter a quarter-turn clockwise 8. Reset your 'change filter' light (if your fridge has one)

Instruction: Considering the features of the product "GoFit Combat Rope with Exercise Training Manual (1.5-Inch Diameter/40-Feet Long, Black)" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: I just ordered mine and can't wait, how durable are the ropes. i ordered the 1.5 by 40 and i'll be working outside my house on concrete floor. is that okay?
Output:
output_field: Let me start first by saying that the workout itself is one of the toughest I have ever done. I am reasonably fit and strong but the rope workout reminds me of doing wind sprints back in college, except this one is for the whole body. I made a mistake of wrapping the rope around a square shaped patio pole whose fairly sharp edge scuffed the rope after about ten minutes of use. So I would suggest you anchor, or wrap the rope around a tree or even better a rounded metal pole. That way the rope will last a long time. I hope this helps.

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "Razer Tartarus Gaming Keypad" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: will my pc still need a reg keyboard for basic typing outside of video games? would a wired keyboard/mouse be better than wireless?
Response:
output_field: Yes and absolutely yes. this keypad barely has enough buttons for the whole alphabet, let alone an entire keyboard. By no means trash a keyboard for this, it's purely meant for a more ergonomic input method. As for the wired/wireless, there are tradeoffs. Personally wired is more reliable, no battery to worry about and no wonky connection issues to deal with. But if you can't configure it to be somewhere comfortable for you within the reach of the wire, that's what wireless is for. Be advised that any wireless device will have at least a tiny bit of lagged input to the computer, so it's not advised for anything competitive.

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "Schumacher SC-1200A/CA SpeedCharge 3/6/12 Amp Charger/Maintainer/Tester" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: Are there differences between this and the SSC-1000A and the SSC-1500A besides charge rate? Why are they SSC and this only SC?
Response:
output_field: There a few small differences with these three chargers. The SC-1200A is the lowest end then the SSC-1000A is in the middle with the SSC-1500 as the highest end. The SC model is a speed charger and will charge at a selectable rate of 3A or 12A. And the battery types it will charge is STD and AGM. The SSC models are a Ship n Shore Speed chargers. They will charge 3 types of batteries, STD (low maintenance/ maintenance free), AGM (Absorbed Glass Mat construction) and GEL (very deep cycle application batteries). The 1000 model will charge at 2A, 6A, or 10A as a selection choice. Where the 1500 model will charge at the rate of 3A or 15A, whichever is selected. Hope this answers your questions.

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "Cobalt Aquatics 5-Watt Mini-Therm Electronic Heaters for Aquarium" answer the inquiry below.
Input: is this heater suitable for a 1/2 gallon tank? if not, can you recommend any that are?
Output:
output_field: Hello RaeRae, You answer is not so simple. The capacity of a heater not only depends on the heater itself, but the original temperature of the medium. Even though this is rated for a larger tank than you are asking about, if the place the tank will be in much colder than average is may be a good choice. If your water starts at 65 degrees, and you want it at 78, this may work for you. If you start at 72, this may get the water hotter than you want. Another aspect to consider is how much water movement you have in your tank. The more water movement, the better the heat will be distributed, and the water will be closer to the thermo's temp setting. I agree with JR, I have not seen any for that small of a size. You could look at reptile heating accessories that afix to the outside of the tank, it would be a hack though.
