output_field: PLEASE DO NOT BUY an INTEX product. Spend the extra few bucks for a Minkota. Customer service is the WORST!!! We broke the tilt mechanism the first time in the water. We have had a claim in since last June. They continue to tell us the part is on back order. We were finally able to get a supervisor to call us back yesterday (after 9 months of calling), who reiterated the same thing. Plus, she still is trying to tell us to return the unit to Amazon, who will not take it back as we didn't get to try it within 14 days of ordering it. INTEX filled the order and it is under warranty, but they apparently would rather me trash them than send the plastic part to me. I believe they are just waiting me out until I give up. What a great business model. But, to answer your original question, you do need to buy a battery that this motor connects to for power while out on the boat.

input_field:
Instruction: Referencing the product "DuPont WFFM350XCH Electric Metered 200-Gallon Deluxe Faucet Mount Premium Water Filtration Filter, Chrome", generate an answer to the specified question.
Input: it is normal for the digital screen to read nothing not even the 000?
Output:
output_field: For anyone who reads this in the future, I had this problem just now. The screen never turned on, but we've been using the filter. I finally called customer service. They had me unscrew the back of the filter, pull it out, unscrew the LED screen section, make sure the area around the button was clean and undamaged (mine was fine), screw that part back on (by this point it turned blue instantly and was working), then put the filter in and rescrew the covering to that on. Flushed for a few minutes until the screen went to zeros. Now it turns on when using to monitor the usage. Customer service is really helpful.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Yamaha THR5 10-Watt Desktop Guitar Combo Amp" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: I am trying to decide between the THR10 and the THR10x. I play mostly late-80s type stuff, with some classic rock thrown in. Which would be better?
Output:
output_field: Hey Patrick. I have the THR5, which has the same sounds as the 10 but a few less features. I play a lot of classic rock and late 80's stuff too and I think the tones are great. I haven't tried the THR10x but from what I read it's geared more towards the metal crowd. For classic rock tones, I find the THR5's and 10's have more than enough gain. I was really impressed with how responsive it is to pinch harmonics and feedback. Get some really cool early ZZ Top and even GNR tones on it. The effects are awesome too. The tremelo and flange are pretty authentic. If you're not really bothered about saving patches or having an extra control for aux-in volume, you can save even more bucks and get the THR5. My ONLY complaint is with the whole range, and it's a very small complaint... the power switch is actually plastic. Mine's snapped off after I clipped it with my headstock. Still works though. Anyway, hope that helps. These things definitely make practice more convenient without sacrificing tone.

input_field:
Instruction: In light of the product "RCA RD-1006 Discwasher Vinyl Record Care System" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: vinyl records: Can I clean and repair scratches with my Maxell CD/DVD kit?
Output:
output_field: No. For at least two reasons. #1) Records and CD's are made from different materials. The Maxell kit is essentially acrylic car wax, made specifically for the type of plastic CD's are made from. Vinyl LP's use a completely different kind of plastic. #2) Records and CD's store information differently. The CD repair kit doesn't bring back missing information, but it restores the surface just enough that the laser can read sufficient digital data to reconstruct the information it thinks should be there. An analog vinyl LP is a "dumb" system; the needle just plays what's in the groove - damage, dust, dirt, etc. It all looks the same to the needle, and it has no way of knowing what should be there. Sorry Amazon, there's really no need to buy expensive record cleaning solutions. A drop of mild dish-soap in a cup of distilled warm water, wiped gently with soft cloths on the LP (and vacuumed completely dry with a small shop vacuum - that's something you can buy from Amazon that) will help alot, but scratches can't be magically made to disappear by any means.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Campbell Mfg Llc 2"  Quietsewage Chk Valve B-0823-20C Well Supply Accessories" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: Will I need to apply PVC cement to this valve's connections, or do they work like 'unions' where I may twist the valve off?
Output:
output_field: The two connecting fittings must be glued to the exit pipe ends taking care to get the two sections as straight as possible. Once glued in place, the valve can be removed by unscrewing the two collars away from these pipe fittings and pulling the valve sideways and out. There is a rather flat o-ring that seals the valve itself to this junction, so making sure that the two outside pipes are in a straight line is pretty important for a leak-proof seal. Not sure why they put such a thin o-ring on these fitting ends, a thicker one would allow for more latitude in installing the valve. But once in place, a very quiet valve that eliminates the closing KNOCK of other valves such as Zoeller that I have used.

Output:
output_field: The camera's resolution is 640 x 480, 60 frames per second. That's far from HD, but it is a decent, viewable video image once you pull the AVI files off the MicroSD card. It's also capable of taking stills, but since they are the same 0.3 megapixel resolution as the video, I find it easier to just shoot video and then grab still frames from it. That's especially true since with this outfit you can't see video as you fly, so you have only the vaguest idea of what the camera is seeing. Shooting video, you at least have a decent chance of grabbing a few good stills by choosing your moments.

input_field:
Instruction: Using the details of the product "600mm Lazy Susan Aluminum Bearing 650 lbs Turntable Bearings" formulate a response to the following question.
Query: I want to convert a pair of club chairs with stationary platforms into swivel chairs. Will these support a seated man swiveling?
Response:
output_field: I returned the item shortly after trying to do the same thing as you. It worked, but not very well. It did swivel, but the motion wasn't smooth like you'd prefer it to be. I don't believe it was a weight issue (I'm 5'9" 185 lbs), but rather a design issue. By design, the lazy Susan rotates on a perimeter ball bearing track...whereas a proper chair swivel "swivels" from a single point in the center. I found a number of web retailers that carried recliner chair swivels. Turns out, most chairs have a standard base design, so it was quite easy to swap out the feet on my chair with a swivel that fit perfectly. Now, instead of rotating on a track, the chair spins on an axis.

input_field:
Instruction: In light of the product "Velcro Industrial Strength 4 x 2 Inches Tape, White (90595)" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: Will this work to keep a throw rug anchored to carpet to prevent a tripping hazard?
Output:
output_field: In my opinion, you will want a larger piece, OR you will want to cut multiple strips.. this tape isn't very wide. It will keep the carpet tacked down in place, but the first time someone kicks up a corner, it will definitely come loose. The adhesive just isn't that strong... it may stick pretty good on your (clean) hard wood, but it won't stick that well to the underside of the carpet. If you want to use velcro for this job, you'll want larger pieces of velcro, ideally with a much more durable glue. Several projects I have accomplished with this tape have failed... and I even hot glue gunned the velcro to one of my pieces. That's my experience... good luck. Mark

input_field:
Instruction: In light of the product "Adonis 75 WSP contains Imidacloprid (4 x 2.25 oz. bags)" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: How do I use this to fend off Emerald Ash Borer? Gallons per Pack? Gallons per inch diameter if I Drench at the Base of the Trees?
Output:
output_field: Here's a link to the label: http://www.domyownpestcontrol.com/msds/Adonis75WSP_speclabel.pdf Page 16 and 17 give mix and applications rates for other insects. There are four packets in a bag, and each packet contains 1.6 oz of imidacloprid, the active ingredient. Each packet will root drench a 24-48" of cumulative trunk diameter of tree. Foliar treatment is one packet in 300 gallons. EAB is off-label for this mix and probably won't work long-term unless you treat systemically, ie, inject it into the tree at a 10% mix. Bayer sells pre-loaded injectors just for that, but I don't know the success rate. Some have drilled 1/2" holes into the tree root buttress about 3" deep on 8-12" spacing and filled them with a 10% mix of Adonis. We won't know if it works or not until next year. If you have specimen white ash that you positively must save and are not already infested, the only known successful treatment is called Tree Age. Only licensed applicators can get it, and it'll probably cost $200-$500 per year per tree.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Stanwood Needlecraft Large Metal Yarn/Fiber/Wool/String Ball Winder, 10-Ounce", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: The ball winder keeps jamming and doesn't operate smoothly. The top gear is getting all chipped and leaving plastic flakes. What am I doing wrong?
Response:
output_field: Linda: Sorry to hear you're having difficulty. Here are a few suggestions: 1st - Make sure the yarn is able to flow evenly so once you start to crank the winder, you don't have to stop. 2nd. Make sure the longest metal arm is in tightened down and is in a straight line to the hank of spinning yarn. 3rd. When you begin to crank, continue in the same clockwise direction, never stopping. 4th, the yarn should come off the hank at the same level as the winder, not below it and must flow smoothly. I found if I used my dominant hand to crank and my non-dominant hand to help guide the yarn from the "spinning hank", it worked better than just cranking the winder. My first attempt I had trouble with the crank, getting confused as to which direction I was spinning. Made a mess. I assume you are using something for the hank of yarn to spin on while you crank. Won't work without that. Hope this helped you. If you don't have an "umbrella" for the yarn, here's a suggestion:http://www.amazon.com/Stanwood-Needlecraft-Wooden-Umbrella-Winder/dp/B000IG1I8O/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1388088237&sr=8-2&keywords=yarn+winder

input_field:
Instruction: In light of the product "TEMPO ULTRA WSP, ONE 1.76 ounce (50g) Packet" features, draft a reply to the following question.
Input: why can't i have it in ny?
Output:
output_field: Arshad, It's a restricted use product meaning it's not for sale to individuals unless you're a certified pest control operator. This isn't for all states; just a couple like NY and CT. To confirm what I'm saying, you can contact your local DEC office and ask. You can also go to their website and retrieve the .pdf they keep on line of every registered product for the state. On that list they include if the product is restricted or not and when you look this one up, you'll see it's listed as restricted. Now I also know there are other merchants who don't seem to care taking the chance of selling this item into your state so try buying it from one of them. I'm sure the state of New York will eventually crack down on this practice (and their fines are steep) and when this happens, it will get tougher and tougher to find items like this. But right now if you look hard enough, you should be able to find someone willing to sell some to you.

Instruction: With reference to the product "WeatherTech Custom Fit Cargo Liners for Honda Pilot, Black" please provide an answer to the question below.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "ShelterLogic MAX AP Series Canopy" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: can you pour concrete around the anchers?
Output:
output_field: If you use screw anchors, there is no reason to pour concrete around them. I have seen people pour concrete around the base of the metal columns. Of course, the biggest issue is to put small sheet metal screws thru each joint in the columns and beam members. Once the wind starts blowing, the entire assembly wants to dis-assemble itself. Self tapping sheet metal screws keep the columns and beams from coming disconnected and the entire canopy collapsing.

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "X-Acto Model KS Table- or Wall-Mount Pencil Sharpener (1031)" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: What is the material it's made of like? A couple reviewers said flimsy metal, another said chrome-plated plastic. I'm confused!
Answer:
output_field: I was surprised at how *substantial* the box felt when it arrived (it was only about $12 after all...). I think that stainless steel is a combination of iron and tin and the hollow body of this contraption feels more like stainless steel than that of a tin can and it is shinier than a tin can also and perhaps more thick. I read the previous three answers and if not all, many of them spoke of the cast mounting base -- that feels like an iron skillet and is quite heavy. You will not be able to mount this lovely cutting machine onto a hollow door. Get it! You will probably be at the least happy with it or as me, surprised by how good it is given the price and how many of these things have not seemed to have made it into the new millennium with its 1950's and 1960's integrity in tact.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Navitas Naturals Organic Raw Cacao Powder, 16-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 2)" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: What is the shelf life of this product?
Output:
output_field: About 2 years if resealed and properly stored. I keep mine in a drawer and the bag (if opened correctly) can be resealed. If you store it in sunlight, it'll go bad quickly. As well if you store it a container that lets a lot of oxygen in, it wont keep as long either. My cacao doesn't even last more than a couple of months so this isn't really a problem for me, but my husband and I drink warm cacao every morning and usually add it to our smoothies for its added nutritional content and vitamins. Its also a great source of magnesium which most diets are really lacking in. Hope I answered your question well enough. Oh and nestle's cocoa lasts about 6 months shelf life and has zero nutritional benefits. You can also use this in many, many recipes! I'm working on a cookbook series that will include how to use this, in the next few months! If you want more health fact information you can subscribe to my newsletter at www.bestfood4life.com. If you have any additional questions you'd like to ask me personally you can contact me directly there as well. Enjoy your cacao powder!!

input_field:
Instruction: With reference to the product "Nivea Q10 Skin Firming Body Lotion , 13.5 fl oz  (Pack of 2)" please provide an answer to the question below.
Question: does this help with cellulite?
Answer:
output_field: I think the only thing that got rid of my cellulite was exercise and diet along with a good amount of patience. I lost 50 pounds over the last year and the cellulite went away but it did leave me with loose skin. The cream is helping that but since I am 67 it is taking a lot longer for my skin to shrink back up. The younger you are, the faster your skin recovers. The cream is good because it hydrates the skin and helps keep it supple. I don't believe there is really any cream that gets rid of cellulite. Cellulite is simply fat under the skin and loosing weight slowly (1-2 pounds per week) is the answer. Hope this helps.

input_field:
Instruction: Considering the features of the product "Zodiac R0452500 16-Feet Port Sensor with O-Ring Replacement Kit for Select Zodiac Jandy PureLink AquaPure Water Purification System" respond to the related inquiry.
Input: I bought this sensor and replaced it. Still getting 121 code. What now? Replace the cell???
Output:
output_field: Well, in my humble opinion we (Jandy owners) have been taken to the cleaners on everything they sell salt-wise. Did you clean the cell with diluted acid? If so try that. Did you install the sensor with the new chip adaptor? If so, take off the adapter. It is a really bad fix. It seems to make all the bugs that everyone complains about worse by increasing, rather than decreasing, the sesitivity of the sensor. I got a few months (my non-heated season) out of my sensor (with one cleaning midway) by removing that jumper. I too am now getting a 121. I am going to clean the cell tomorrow, make sure the three prone plugs are clean, reboot the whole thing, and see what happens. If it doesn't fix, I am turning the whole thing off, saving my money, and buying something that works. Good luck.

input_field:
Instruction: Pertaining to the product "Beyerdynamic DT 770 PRO, 250 ohms", offer a response to the accompanying inquiry.
Query: Why are there 3 different ohm options? What differs between them?
Response:
output_field: the 32ohm version is made to be run off just about anything, and still retain good volume and dynamics. the 80ohm is tuned for a bit more bass than the other models. at 80ohm it sits on the border of needing or not needing an amp. I personally thought it needed one when I listened to it out of my phone. the 250ohm definitely needs an amp, and is the most balanced sounding of the 3 versions. it's far from a balanced headphone though. I only say balanced in comparison to the other ohm versions of the same headphone. the 250ohm version is really made for a studio plugged into monitoring equipment. doesn't mean you cant use it at home, but you have to have an amp. just remember this with headphones, the lower the ohm, the more likely it will sound good just plugged right into a source. as the ohm goes up, volume and dynamics start to suffer, to the point that a separate amp will be required. if you don't want to use an amp, get the 32ohm.

input_field:
Instruction: Reflecting on the product "JBL LSR305 Studio Monitor" answer the inquiry below.
Input: How directional are these? I want to use them for general music/movies and can't have them on stands at ear level. will they fill a 10x10 room?
Output:
output_field: The horizontal dispersion of these is incredibly wide, but the vertical dispersion is much narrower - assuming 6' listening distance and the speakers sitting flat, you would start losing top end about 4' above the tweeters. This could be solved with some mopads or similar with an upward tilt though. As for filling a 10' x 10' room with sound, it will, but with nowhere near the bass impact they have in near-field. I use a pair of these for outdoor listening at low-moderate levels, and add 12dB of EQ below 110Hz, with a 30Hz 24dB/octave high pass filter, and they sound like much bigger speakers than they really are, but with the level of EQ applied obviously can't be pushed hard. In a room with careful placement to optimize bottom end, you could probably get away with 3-6dB of boost in the bottom end to get them filling the room. That said, adding the LSR310S would be the best solution for room filling sound with these monitors...

All other vendors have provided the exact product as the high end department stores.

input_field:
Instruction: Based on the product "Snap-E Mouse Trap-6 Pack" characteristics, provide a solution to the given query.
Question: I have set the trap properly four times. Each time the mouse eats the bait and gets away. A couple of times the trap dehinges and won't snap. Help?
Answer:
output_field: Don't try to engage the release mechanism "lightly". It won't trigger. Push down firmly in the bar until there's a small snap and a slight bounce of the platform. When I sat at the table with the traps, setting and releasing with a screw driver, I found I could set some up so they would not trigger. People experienced with old-style traps may have a tendency to mis-set these traps by trying to use a light touch to maximize sensitivity. This will cause the trap to look set but not be trippable by a mouse. Ironically, the situation of stolen bait increases the likelihood of the user mis-setting these traps as the user tries to increase sensitivity. The bad reviews of this trap are likely devices used without the trigger mechanism properly engaged.
